title: As advertised - location and clean. The rooms are very functional . . A special mention to Chanel , Andrise and Michael
text: The rooms are functional and clean . The staff is amazing. A special mention to Chanel , Andrise  and Michael . I am sure there are many more behind the scenes . Prime location with many shows and restaurants near by . Chanel , Andrise and Michael are always there to help out as needed.

title: Great stay, wonderful staff
text: Just got back from a 4 night stay. Very enjoyable. Clean, quiet room. Comfortable bed. Very nice breakfast. Great location for catching a Broadway show or hitting midtown sites. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Greeted us every time we came back for the night. Set up a car to take us to JFK that was cheaper than Uber. Would like to especially acknowledge Tyler. He was fantastic at finding solutions for any issues we had come up and really made us feel like he enjoyed working with us. Will certainly stay here again next time we are in New York

title: Idéalement placé et accueillant
text:
Hotel super bien situé à 5 mn de times square.  Chambre spacieuse avec petite cuisine équipée d un frigo, de plaques de cuisson,  four et lave-vaisselle. 
Grande douche.  Shampoing et gel douche à disposition. Ménage quotidien.  Serviettes changées tous les jours. 
Personnel très agréable, souriant et à l'écoute. 
Petit dej salé et sucré,  café et thé à volonté toute la journée. 
Points négatifs : salle petit dej pas adaptée,  mauvaise insonorisation des chambres.  Nous avons eu froid. Pour l ascenseur mieux vaut etre patient. 
Nous recommandons cet établissement pour sa situation géographique,  son confort et l accueil du staff.

title: Have a great time in Manhattan
text: We had a long stay at this hotel. We received very courteous attention to every detail (even a birthday gift), very grateful especially to Sanda, Chanel, Michel, Tyler, and Andrise. Highly recommended! Its near the Broadway shows and everything you want to do!

title: Great service
text: Though the room left something to be desired, (extremely limited space- bed and half sofa), the personnel was top notch. Chanel, Santa, and Andrise were very personable and fun to talk to. I believe they are an asset in a market with so much competition. Such customer service should be recognized. Would stay again, but in a larger room.

title: Ideal location and perfect amenities
text:
I would recommend this property to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of bustling Manhattan. Tucked between Hell's Kitchen and Times Square - perfect for tourists!  Breakfast was lovely (we just took it back to our room to enjoy cuz we had small trays in the room to use to carry food!) and lots of selection (muffins, croissant, oatmeal with SO MANY TOPPINGS!!!, yogurts, hot dishes like eggs and quiche and sausage, english muffins, bagels, 3 typs of juices, milks, coffees and teas!).  Property was clean and the room ideal for staying in NYC - with a small kitchen!!  Perfect.  I have seen reviews that the elevator is slow.... it is!!!      :-D      Who cares?  We are in NY and relaxed and so what if the elevator is slow??  LOL.    Take the stairs if you want!  
THANK YOU to Michael, Joel, Tyler, Fidel, Maria !!!  Bravo on taking pride in your property and helping us enjoy our stay!

title: What you need in the theater district, but not more.
text: Good location for theater and central Manhattan. Small room, but what you need. Clean. Comfy bed. Plugs where you need them. Good WiFi. Standard breakfast with fine oatmeal and toppings. Spare lobby. Pleasant and helpful desk staff. Lots of dining options nearby.

title: Great stay for families!
text: We had a great stay when visiting. We were able to walk to time square, broadway and Rockefeller center. Felt safe and comfortable. Hotel was clean. We were able to get early check in and late check out. Also, the food service workers went out of their way to make sure we were able to get a bagel on the go since we missed the free breakfast. Everyone was so kind and helpful to us. Will definitely stay here again when visiting New York.

title: Thank you MS Chanel
text:
My name is Detective Doc aka Det.Doc on IG.    I protect some of the worlds most valuable people.  I've been to just about every hotel in the world. So to say the hospitality of MS. Chanel was far past the norm would not be an overstatement.
I would personally allow her to speak with any of my clients and in the future bi plan to support this hotel with upcoming travels.  Location was perfect for all local activities.  This hotel is a must stay!

title: Meh
text: Average hotel. Needs attention to a few things. They advertise a pullout coach in the queen room. It’s non existent. It would only for a new born and it closes off the bathroom. You can’t get in. We had this booked way in advance and had to start looking for a new hotel for the three of us. Santa then came out to the car to offer us another room. Thank you Santa. Much appreciated. So we made it work. Nice location. Close to everything breakfast was horrible one thing on the menu (bagels) my son could eat and they had three and then gone. We were there for five nights. Once the early birds took at the parties back to their room they weren’t replenished. So none for anyone else. Ran out of camomile tea. Just terrible. The same sausages all week. No breakfast eating area. We were  happy not o have to wait a half an hour for an elevator as with the larger hotels.  But this is not really a marriot. Our room was very clean and there was always someone cleaning in the hotel.

title: Perfect location
text:
Great experience would stay again!
Perfect location and everyone was great. Stay was for work travel. Able to visit Time Square and enjoy time in the New York Area. 
Chanel was excellent and very professional and  helpful! Great customer service.

title: Outstanding stay other than the SLOW elevator.
text:
Well priced stay at a very comfortable hotel just a long block and a half off times square. The room I had faced the back so only other properties, which made it VERY quiet. Not sure how it would have been in the front, but this street does seem quieter than most overnight. But all streets have trash pickup on some days which is super noisy and very early. I didn't partake in the breakfast so cannot rate that.  Front desk staff - all three I interacted with over 26 hours, were super kind and helpful. I'm a titanium member for reference on hotel experience. Shower pressure not great but acceptable. Smartly designed bathroom with sliding door to not take up too much space. Oh, and no real desk in the bedroom, but there is a small table you can move to sit in front of the mini-sofa and use like a desk. A little more space is dedicated to the kitchenette than I would have preferred, but someone actually cooking might have appreciated that. 

To my comment in the title, the elevator is one of the slowest I've experienced. I climbed 7 flights multiple times to avoid the wait. This should be addressed.

title: ABSOLUTLY THE beST MARRIOT FROM NEW YORK
text:
Wauwwww the rooms are truly AMAZING and i travel a lot, also in Marriot Hotels small and big Marriot Hotels. The staff is SUPER friendly and welcomming and helpful, the receptionist even offered me a piece of her pizza. Beds are super good, super clean and the energy in the hotel is just super good and the rooms are really quitte and cute.
Absolutely recommendable!!! Thank you for the amazing stay. 10 PLUS

title: NY on a nutshell
text:
Muy atentos todos. El desayuno cumplidor. Las habitaciones limpias y la cocina es un 10.
A solo 30 metros de la estacion de subte q te conecta con todo.
La señora Maria espectacular atencion estaba en todo los detalles y te hace sentir muy comodo.
Super recomiendo

title: Muy contenta con la atención
text:
Perfecta atención por parte de todos los empleados muy amables y atentos, la habitación muy cómoda, y el desayuno muy bueno y completo, Maria da una atención muy atenta y familiar.
Muy contenta de haber vivido mi experiencia de New York en este hotel

title: Compfy beds!
text: I stayed 2 weeks at this hotel, had to experience 3 different rooms (for external reasons) and all 3 were just perfect! Very compfy beds and perfectly clean. The first and second rooms were huge! The staff was super nice with me in all time and the breakfast was good. If I had to add something to make it better, only wish they had a variety of fruits. I definitely will stay in this hotel again. Thank you!

title: Great staff and location
text: The hotel is extremely well located, walkable to everything in theater district & Times Square. Well-stocked kitchenette and nice room size. The management and staff were excellent, so amazing and ready to help, especially Santa at the front desk!

title: Great staff and location
text:
My mom and I stayed there for a NYC Broadway weekend. The entire staff (shout out to Santa!) goes out of their way to make sure you have a great stay. 
Walking distance to the Theater district, Times Square and Hells Kitchen neighborhoods. I was concerned that it would be super noisy at night- but we never had an issue. 
Would def come back!

title: Experiencia de visita a Nueva York 5 días
text: Fue 100/100 todo volveré pronto me encantó la atención de Santa muy amable cordial las personas que conforman el equipo de trabajo ahí muy atentas muy serviciales la zona muy segura y cerca de times Square la habitación muy cómoda con cocina y refri para todas tus necesidades el metro a unos cuantos pasos gracias por todo townplace Manhattan 44 y Santa de las mejores experiencias lo recomiendo en absoluto este hotel ya sea para placer o negocios

title: Great hotel
text: I recently stayed at   TownePlace suites for a short weekend getaway and truly felt at home. The facility was extremely  cleaned from the lobby to my room. The lobby offered daily morning breakfast which had a great spread and comfortable couches for lounging.  The staff was pleasant and professional and offered various suggestions on restaurants and activities around the area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and plan on coming back during my next stay :)

title: Nice stay
text:
After reading some previous reviews, I have to agree with a few points.

Firstly, I must say the folks at the front desk are genuinely friendly, polite, and upbeat, which speaks volumes about their quality of service.

My room was clean and felt secure, especially since you needed a key for the elevator.

The hotel is no-frills and quite small, only six floors with a slow elevator, but thankfully, noise wasn't an issue in my room, although I can't comment on street-facing rooms since mine had no view.

For Broadway enthusiasts, the location is unbeatable, just a minute's walk from shows like Spamalot.

However, a downside is the lack of authority at the front desk to resolve issues directly. I had trouble with my booking through the app and had to call the hotel directly to make a reservation. Despite providing documentation and being quoted a certain rate including bonus points, the only solution offered was to contact Marriott. It's surprising given their pro-customer service attitude.

title: Muy buena relacion-precio calidad
text: Habitaciones muy limpias, personal muy amable, desayuno bueno, las habitaciones son cómodas, el baño es suficientemente cómodo. Excelente ubicación, con varias estaciones de metro cerca, fácil de ubicar si vas por primera vez a New York

title: Wish I could stay longer
text: Chantel and Andrise are very kind! The room was nice and clean. The eggs at the free breakfast tasted kind of sticky but everything else was good. Beverages available all day and staff was super helpful. My one thing was I came to the desk to check out early. I was due to check out the next day. The FD agent said I was all set with my bill. I thought I had time to check out but housekeeping knocked at my door around 6:00pm with no warning. Front desk called after they knocked. I understand you have to clean the room to reuse but I paid for the whole day and didn't appreciate being nicely rushed out. How could I say no to some nice room attendants though, you know?

title: Broadway Week Surprised my Girls!
text:
I read some mixed reviews before booking a quick trip during Broadway week. 

I booked a king room with a sofa bed 
I talked with Sandra at the front desk prior to arriving about the room etc. 
she was informative.   I decided to book

Check in went smooth. Lobby was small very clean.  Remember this isn’t a large hotel with the big lobby. It clean and well appointed. 
Room was very nice. Super clean 
Bathroom was spotless 
The room had a small kitchen and was also spotless 

They offer coffee in the lobby and continental  breakfast. My girls did get a snack and we found the food was stocked and fresh. This isn’t full breakfast 

I used their fitness center   It had basis gym equipment and treadmills. 

We stored our bags without a fee. They offer coffee and water 
In their lobby. 

Location.  This is in waking distance of both Penn Station and Port authority
Times Square is very close. We were in the city to see a show and we were able to walk everywhere 

Will stay again 100%.

title: Una opción genial para Nueva York
text:
Nos hemos alojado una semana en este hotel y todo ha sido perfecto.
El personal del hotel es muy amable y hacen todo lo posible por ayudarte.
Lo que más valoramos es la limpieza, comodidad de la cama y un buen baño y este hotel cumple con todo.
El desayuno está incluido en el precio y tiene variedad de dulce y salado por lo que puedes ahorrar un poquito en tu estancia ya que Nueva York es una ciudad cara.
La ubicación es excelente, muy cerca de todo y con el metro en la puerta.
Para nosotros ha sido todo un acierto y se lo recomendaremos a todo el mundo.
Muchas gracias por todo!!!!

title: Very nice hotel in a perfect location where you have WhatsApp you need yo enjoy of your visit yo NY
text:
- Very near to Times Square, so perfect location.
- Big and comfortable bed.
- Spacious bathroom with everything you need.
- Kitchen with ceramic hob and microwave, so you can cook if you need it.
- Breakfast buffet with good food, so you can save some money. I recomend to go early because the room is small and there are few tables.
-Don't be too noisy because you can hear very clear whatever happens in the aisle.

We had a really good experience and we would repeat here if we came back to NY.

title: Wonderful stay in the Big Apple
text: The hotel is extremely well located to visit NYC.  About 10 minutes walk from Times Square and 5 minutes from nearest subway entrance.  It is also just next door to a covered parking.  Also to be noted, the excellent serviced delivered by Joel n the breakfast area.  Not only he is insuring that the breakfast area is always complete, but he can also provide excellent guidance to visit NYC.

title: Will Stay Here Again
text:
This hotel is in a great location, in a very safe area, and offers a wonderful breakfast, complimentary. The price was so reasonable for NYC with its above mentioned positives. 
 Front desk Micheal and Dilesica were helpful and displayed a positive attitude toward guests.

title: Poor Service
text: I stayed at the TownePlace Suites New York Manhattan/Times Square in January 2024. Mixed review. I found the room to be very comfortable and quiet, and the hotel is in a great location very close to Times Square but quieter than any hotel I've ever stayed at in the area. The service was not great, though. I felt like the front desk yelled at me when I arrived because I didn't know the entrance was locked - I didn't have a key yet, since I hadn't checked in before it was locked. A little later in the evening, I noticed the door to the pantry in the lobby was open, so I went to grab an apple. While I was waiting for a friend in the lobby eating the apple, someone from the front desk came over and yelled about the pantry doors being open, telling the other person at the desk how the pantry should be closed. I felt really embarrassed to be eating the apple because there were other people in the lobby - I just didn't know the pantry was off limits because the pantry doors were open when I waiting for my friend. Also, I bought a 5000 bonus points package and the points were never credited to my account. When I called the hotel, they had no ability to add the points and redirected me to Bonvoy's Titanium line. When I called Bonvoy, they seemed confused about why the hotel couldn't add the points, saying it's the hotel's responsibility. Bonvoy did credit the points though.

title: Loved the experience!
text:
We were put in a room on the 6th floor - nice view. Everything was clean and we had a full kitchenette. 
The staff at the front desk were kind and friendly.
I loved the fact that we were within walking distance from Times Square.
They do have breakfast included but note that there are minimal spaces and a small breakfast. Only had some toast/bagels, oatmeal, scrambled eggs and turkey patties. I was expecting bacon and pancakes - so the breakfast was the only disappointment.
Additionally, there is only 1 elevator so it takes forever to get to your room. 
Overall, would come again :)

title: Friendliest Hotel Team in NYC
text: From the minute we booked our reservation, to calling before our arrival, at check in, and every interaction with many of the staff here at the TownePlace Suites - Time Square, including checking out with Michael at the front desk…all have been so Friendly and Helpful!  Thanks for the GREAT stay!

title: Truly AMAZING, thank you the Staff of the TownePlace.
text:
Truly AMAZING!!! I would give this place a solid 99% for the attention of the staff and room itself out of 100% (I explain why 1% deduction). We stayed at @211 - the perfect room, except for the drafty window frames. It's more of Marriot's issue for using cheap material, so that is the reason for the 1% deduction. 
Now the amazing 99% - the staff!!! FROM HEAD TO TOE truly dedicated and super friendly. The front desk colleagues - day or night - always greet you with a warm smile and a cheeky chat - ladies you were fab!!! :-). The breakfast area is catered nonstop and choices are sufficient for a good filling breakfast. Just a few feet /meters away from the NYC Subway station (easy access to JFK on the E-Line), 4 min walk to TimeSquare. FoofEmporium or Target are just a 3/6min walk as well as CVS for your food and convenience needs. 
THANK YOU GUYS and looking forward to seeing you again!!!

title: Great Breakfast Staff!
text: The best thing about our stay was the people who managed and worked in the breakfast buffet area. They were very efficient and patient and hardworking. Their up-beat  and polite attitude started each one of our days with a smile!

title: Fantastic Townplace by Times Square
text: We thoroughly enjoyed Townolace Hotel. It’s a great Marriott property,  very clean and placed just right 2 blocks from Times Square. I cannot say enough praises about the staff on every shift. The checking in was seamless and the ladies and gentlemen were seriously the best and so nice. The maids were so attentive and from getting us fresh towels to taking the trash off they were on it! Overall great location and amazing staff!

title: Awesome staff and management
text: My wife and I stayed here in December 2023. We had stayed for a week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was perfect. The staff and management were excellent. The breakfast was good. Excellent location in New York City. We both highly recommend this hotel.

title: An easier way to do Broadway
text: Perfect location! Got Spot Hero parking a few doors away, were able to check in early- room very well appointed- & then walked one block to see a Broadway show & had quick dinner nearby .....despite being in the heart of theater district, we heard minimal outside noise & slept well.....boutique hotel - free breakfast but we just got coffee & checked out...will definitely stay here again for our next Broadway outing....

title: Fantastic customer service, clean and comfy
text:
Awesome experience at this hotel. The beds were comfy. Free breakfast was well-stocked with a diverse amount of food. 

The first night we were there, there was too much street noise for us light sleepers. I spoke to Michael at the front desk and he graciously offered to move us to a different room. But not only did he just move us, he actually offered to personally walk me around the hotel to show me how the other rooms were configured differently (some had full size couches, some had just a chair, some rooms were less spacious, etc). I was so grateful for his kindness and customer service. 

Everyone else at the front desk was also lovely and helpful. I kept seeing staff members checking the breakfast station to make sure they weren’t running out of food, which is so appreciated. The staff really seemed to care about the comfort of their guests. Rooms were very clean. Also, the lobby always has hot water and coffee available at all hours. 

My only tip for parents with young kids, or any light sleepers, is to request a room on the inside of the hotel so that you aren’t facing the street. 

The location was also fantastic. It was very close to Times Square. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Very friendly
text: The hotel is brand new and very nice. Very clean and safe. This is absolutely the friendliest hotel I’ve ever stayed at. Everyone is so welcoming, especially Michael and Chanel at the front desk. They always greeted me with a smile and made sure I had everything I needed.

title: Great staying last week in NY
text: Really want to thank the staff, mainly Dileska, Michael, Joel, Kristy and Maria, for the superb service they offer in this hotel. Many hotels have great installations and amenities like this one, but the people here is what makes a great difference. They make your staying in New York an easier and fun experience. Thanks for evrrything guys! 👍👍 Ng

title: Amazing stay!
text: Such beautiful and clean rooms!! The staff is so amazing and ready to help. We visited with a large group of family and everyone was so friendly and really made our experience great! Special thanks to Joel for making our mornings lovely during breakfast, and Andries and Sante for always having smiles on their faces and being so accommodating for our family. 100% would recommend and return to this hotel!!!

title: Great location with warm staff
text: Excellent location walkable to everything in theater district & Times Square. Wonderful to have well-stocked kitchenette and nice room size. Wonderful staff greeted us each time we entered & left the building. New favorite place to stay in NYC.

title: Nice and central place
text:
Clean and very central place, 5 minutes from Times Square and all the principal attractions in Manhattan…I really love it, you can walk through all the principal avenues.
Dileska at the front desk is very kind, we definitely will return.

title: Great place to stay in Times Square!
text: We were in NYC to participate in the NYC Marathon. The location was central to every where we wanted to go. The property was very clean and well maintained. The staff was professional, courteous, and where very helpful! The breakfast was well attended and we enjoyed it every morning.  We were very pleased with our stay and we will definitely be staying here when we visit NYC again!

title: Two great stays
text:
I stayed at this property twice in October 2023 and had a wonderful experience both times. Staff was welcoming and accommodating and both rooms I stayed in were clean.

I had see. Some negative reviews about the elevator and although there is only one and it is maybe slower than you’d like, I never spent more than a few minutes waiting for it either time I went. It truly was a nonissue.

The location of this hotel is super convenient if you’re spending time seeing Broadway shows (which is usually my purpose for visiting NYC), the price is super fair for the accommodations, and I appreciated that there was complimentary breakfast as an option.

My partner and I have already decided to make this our Midtown hotel every time we visit to see shows. Thanks to the staff for two great stays!

title: Great location, welcoming staff.
text: This is a great hotel! Very convenient location, a block or less to a subway station. The front desk staff (Daniel) was outstanding. He made us feel very welcome. The rooms include a kitchen, but, as is typical of New York hotels, the room was fairly small overall. The room was very clean & housekeeping kept it that way. Breakfast was fine, pretty much the typical type of thing that you find at Townplace Suites. The workout room was pretty minimal & had no spin-type workout bike, so I didn't use it. One thing that we were happy to take advantage of was that the front desk had umbrellas to loan out. It poured rain while we were there, so it was great to be able to borrow an umbrella! They must have quite a few, as there were several of us asking to borrow & we all got one. In addition to being close to the subway, this location was within a mile of a Whole Foods, Target, the Barclay Center, the Brooklyn Museum & gardens, as well as lots of places to eat. We will definitely stay here again the next time we're in Brooklyn.

title: Outstanding New City Hotel Experience
text: This hotel is in a fantastic location for touring with easy access to parking, and is in excellent condition!  We stayed at several different Marriotts on this trip and most had great teams and service.  This location has an absolutely fantastic team! Andrise is a shining star on their team, and everyone else was awesome too!  They were extremely welcoming and helpful from check in to check out!  Whether we had questions on restaurants or needed subway directions, they were there to help!  When we would leave in the morning to tour and when we came back at night, it was like we were talking with old friends!  We highly recommend this team and hotel to anyone looking for an enjoyable time in New York City!

title: Clean, comfortable Hotel in a Great Location
text:
We stayed here in September 2022 and as we lived the location and room booked for a 5 night stay this year.
We weren't disappointed; the hotel is clean and housekeeping every day was a bonus. The facilities in room are excellent- fully equipped kitchen area plus a good shower and comfortable bed.
We enjoyed the free breakfast, had no issues with the lift and the staff were friendly and helpful.
If we come back to NYC we would stay here again.

title: Great Friendly Staff
text: Great Friendly staff at the hotel. Both Michael & Santa were brilliant and extremely helpful. Professionals such as these, makes a stay at any property pleasant. Would love to visit again this week staying at the same property.

title: Très bien situé dans Manhattan
text: Très bien situé à proximité de Times Square, métro à 150 m, résidence hôtelière moderne, très propre, calme, studio très bien aménagé un peu petit et manque de rangement mais avec tout ce qu'il faut dans la kitchenette, le personnel est disponible, très aimable et efficace, bon petit déjeuner, boissons et café disponibles gracieusement en journée....

title: Started off bad but ended well.
text:
When we first arrived, we were told wlour reservation got bumped and we did not get the room we reserved. This was very upsetting because there were 3 of us and we had 1 small bed to share. I ended up sleeping on a chair (literally) and the AC did t work and it was so hot. I opened a window but there was too much street noise being so close to times square. That first night was horrible and it was frustrating that we reserved a room 6 months in advance and got bumped and didnt get what we paid for. We were told that we would get a partial reimbursement but that never happened.

The next day, after some confusion about switching rooms  we were eventually placed in a room with a queen bed and a pull out bed and with an AC that worked. This was so much better. The day staff, Michael and Dileska, were very nice and helpful throughout all the confusion and overbooking mess. All of the staff were friendly and professional but we really spent more time talking with Michael and Dileska and they both were really great and helpful!

title: WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE IN YEARS. DO NOT RECOMMEND.
text: The stay was a complete disaster because of a 24/7 very loud cracking noise coming from the elevator, every time the doors opens on any floor! In busy times, the noise would happen every few seconds. At night, it would happen intermittently but regularly, making comfy sleep impossible even with earplugs. I find it unprofessional and disrespectful to rent an expensive King size room with such creeping problem. It ruined a part of our stay, because after a busy day in the city, we didn't look forward to coming back to our roomnor could properly rest. And we stayed 5 nights. One expects much more from a Marriott hotel, and it is an enormous disappointment with the brand. Management violated all principles of proper hospitality when, despite the horrible circumstances of the rooms close to the elevators, they decided to ignore the well-being of guests and rent those rooms regardless of the utter and absolute discomfort the cracking noise brings to guests. Shame on you. You lost at least two clients.

title: Wonderful place to stay - Outstanding Customer Serivce
text:
The customer service at the hotel was amazing.  The front desk greeted us every time we walked in.  The two extremely minor issues were resolved  immediately.  As we ate their included breakfast, staff walked around and picked up our used plates.  The food was fresh and pleasant.  The room was very clean.  The bed quite comfortable.  The warm cookies at the front desk in the late afternoon tasted amazing.  I really cannot say enough nice things about our stay.

If you are looking for an affordable, comfortable, clean and customer service focused place to stay mere blocks from Time Square you cannot do any better than this hotel.

title: Great hotel
text:
We had 6 nights here to explore New York. 
The staff are friendly and helpful. 
Our room was perfect nice and quiet. 
Breakfast was good lots of choice and well maintained by staff. 
The location is perfect for site seeing, so close to Broadway and Times Square. 
We really enjoyed our stay here thanks.

title: Great hotel for a weekend in NYC
text:
So, when I was looking for a hotel, I wanted something centrally located to the various shows we were attending.  I like staying at Marriott Bonvoy hotels because they are generally ver consistent across the board in their offerings.  That said, while the room was small, it worked well for our short weekend trip.  If we were staying longer, the room size might have been a problem.

Some things I really liked about the hotel included:
- friendly staff; we were greeted each time we entered the hotel
- nice lobby area with coffee/tea and a pretty decent little breakfast area
- the hotel locked the front doors after 7pm and you could only get in with a key

title: Séjour à New York
text:
Hotel à quelques minutes à pied de Times Square mais assez excentré du marasme de la foule. Jolie chambre bien agencée et équipée d'une kitchenette avec tout le nécessaire (plaques, micro onde, lave vaisselle, frigo, cafetière, assiettes, verres et couverts). Ce fut un gros plus lors de notre séjour de 9 jours, après une bonne journée de visite, il est appréciable de pouvoir se poser et manger tranquillement dans sa chambre. L'espace de la chambre est suffisant pour deux personnes, peut être pas pour trois adultes. Le personnel était très accueillant et souriant. Mention spéciale pour Mickael, fort sympathique et agréable. La chambre était nickel, faite chaque jour. Merci également au personnel de ménage pour leur travail.
Le seul point négatif est l'espace du petit déjeuner, seulement 5 tables pour l'ensemble de l'hôtel. Si vous venez au delà de 7h30, il sera compliqué de pouvoir s'y installer. C'est dommage. Malgré tout, nous sommes très satisfaites de notre séjour.

title: Wonderful hotel, location and staff!
text:
Love, love, love this hotel!  This was our 2nd time staying here and could not be happier with the hotel itself, the location and the more than excellent customer service!
Upon arrival we were unfortunately placed in a wheelchair accessible room (not what I booked) due to availability issues.  This room was very uncomfortable and not functional for our needs whatsoever.  We spoke to one of the front desk agents and were told there were no other rooms available which was disappointing, but we held out hope since we had had such a great experience on a previous stay.  We stuck it out through the first night and the next morning my daughter spoke to front desk agent, Santa, who was AMAZING!  She said she would move our rooms as soon as possible but didn't have anything at that moment.  That was absolutely no problem for us as we were going out for the day anyway.  We packed up all our belongings and Santa held our bags for us till later in the day when we returned and we changed rooms.  
The room had a King size bed, small kitchenette and perfectly sized bathroom.  The lobby has coffee and tea 24 hours and the buffet breakfast is fantastic.  
Santa was our saving angel and can't wait to go back to TownePlace Suites Manhattan.  So close to Times Square, subway, eateries, shopping etc.  Perfect location, facility and staff.  
Thank you Santa!

title: Excelente Ubicación y mejor servicio.
text: Excelente ubicación y mejor servicio.  Santa fue un éxito en nuestra estadía, fue muy gentil y ayudadora.  Nos hizo trámites de transportación y nos recomendó restaurantes.  El hotel está muy céntrico a diferentes puntos de interés en pleno corazón de Manhattan, muchos restaurantes cercanos.

title: Absolutely abysmal stay
text: This hotel is absolutely horrible. Only one elevator and no service elevator, and it was frequently broken. I had to take the stairs to the 7th floor repeatedly. Housekeeping seemed to come only when they felt like it. The room was too hot, AC didn’t seem to work. Would never stay here again.

title: Best Bang for Your Buck in NYC
text: I have never been made feel more cared for by the staff. Period. I've stayed all over the world and for what this place gives you you will never find a better bang for your buck.The Breakfast is Amaz.

title: SCONSIGLIO ! FATE ATTENZIONE
text:
ho prenotato quest hotel con la mia carta, da cui poco prima dell’arrivo è stato giustamente addebitato l’acconto.
Una volta arrivati in hotel e fatto il check in , mio marito ha deciso di iniziare a saldare tutto il resto dell’importo con la sua carta. (Sono stati presi più soldi del dovuto ma abbiamo pensato fosse una sorta di caparra in caso di bevande extra etc) fin qui tutto ok, una volta rientrati a casa , abbiamo notato che anche nella mia carta usata x la prenotazione è stato tolto il saldo dell’importo, già pagato da mio marito. Ci siamo lamentati abbiamo chiamato scritto e recensito ovunque ma ad oggi nessuno ci ha restituito nulla e ci hanno RUBATO il doppio dell’importo. Prenotate altrove! Allego foto della ricevuta di pagamento con la data e del mio estratto conto da cui hanno tolto acconto e ritolto date (ho cancellato ovviamente i dati importanti)

title: Atención Sta. Santa
text: Queremos agradecer la atención brindada en la recepción del hotel por la Srta. Santa , quien nos brindo una cordial bienvenida y nos ha orientado el resto de los días y aclarado nuestras consultas tanto del hotel como del resto de la ciudad , por todo esto queremos dejar constancia de su atención para con nosotros .

title: Worst hotel I have had the pleasure of staying in
text:
On our arrival after a 22 hour flight, we were advised there was no room for us for the night.  I had called and confirmed all our bookings 2 weeks prior to our stay. I had a reference number, no room is no room no matter what I had

We were advised that they would put us up for the night at a sister company and would pay the Uber, 45 min later we were in an Uber, just before midnight, we were finally in our room.

Next morning we walked back to the hotel only to be told our room was not ready, 1 hour later we could check in only to find our room was on the 7th floor and the lift was out of service.  Frustrations aside the room was small but nice.

I was awoken at 1am to a loud bang, only to realised was a continuous bag, it sounded like something trying to start up but couldn’t, it is now 6am and I have barely slept is an understatement.  It has been the worst experience for us

title: New Yorkkkkkk
text:
We had a lovely 4 nights here, would go back and stay there again. 
PROS:
comfy bed
very clean and up to date room
friendly staff, who are always greeting you and chatting in general
mini kitchen and fridge to store any items and easily allowable to make a quick snack or drink throughout the day
location is only 5 minutes walk from times square
lots of places to eat/drink/shop nearby
breakfast is complimentary from 6-9am
CONS:
breakfast area was too small every morning so didn't get a chance to have it in the hotel

title: First time to New York
text: Stayed at the TownePlace Suites for 8 nights with my son. First time visiting New York, was on my bucket list.  We honestly couldn’t fault the hotel, it’s in a perfect location for Times Square and subways, our room was at the back - 214 very quiet, the room was lovely, my son (26) slept on the bed settee which he said was very comfortable, I had a queen bed, again very comfortable, kitchenette was ideal too, the room was serviced every day and  fresh towels provided.  Shampoo/conditioner and shower gel is also provided. Buffet breakfast was an added bonus, and coffee/hot water, tea bags etc are available 24/7.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York, always someone on reception to help in person or on the phone.  I❤️NY

title: A Challenging Visit
text:
The hotel is very clean. The rooms are small but standard size for NYC with a galley kitchen. The elevator is very slow and also used by housekeeping staff. We had breakfast the first day, and it was terrible. We arrived shortly after opening and the hot food was cold. We went elsewhere for the remainder of our three night stay. 

The worst problem we encountered was the AC not working in our room 502. We reported the problem the first night, but nothing was done. They next day, we complained and were moved to another room. However, no one from staff checked that AC wasn't working in the new room as well. We came back late from the theater, and the room temperature was 82 degrees. The third night, we were given a third room that staff checked to make sure the AC was working before moving us.

I gave the two star rating because of the location, and some staff were helpful.
We won't return.

title: Belle location mais pas de confort
text: L’hôtel était complet et nous avons obtenus une chambre avec lit king plus divan-lit.  Le lit était très dur et le divan-lit, grandeur simple, ne peut accueillir un adulte ou même un ado.  Le plancher était sale, l’air climatisé donnait de l’air froid mais la fan ne poussait pas l’air dans la chambre,   Malgré tout, le personnel était courtois et n’était pas à blâmer.

title: Be Warned About Two Issues
text:
The location is good, very near to Times Square. However, there are two issues that you should beware if you choose to book this hotel.
The first is the slow noisy elevator. There is only one and it makes a very loud banging noise at every stop. The sound reverberates through the whole building into the rooms. If you are a light sleeper, be warned.
The second is overcharging. When you booked, they will send you a warm welcome email detailing the breakdown of charges for each day. However, they will ignore all that and blatantly overcharge you. The frontline staff are trained to lie and tell you that they will refund the difference in a few days. But they will ignore all your emails you send to ask about it. President Biden has personally condemned such business practices and tries to pass the Junk Fees Prevention Act. So, be warned that this is a dishonest hotel and you will be charged more than what you sign up for.

title: I will never come again to this brand and hotel
text: 我們在這邊住了五日， 房間本身非常小， 設備老舊， 同時 會頻繁的發出噪音， 晚上睡眠會有很大的影響， 酒店不提供任何用品 只有提供毛巾， 飯店空調有很大的問題， 房間很悶熱， 我們住的一晚發現空調真的壞了， 所以連夜要求我們換房， 但是換到另一間其實空調問題沒有改善， 應該是他們空調主機冷卻水塔的問題。 酒店服務人員態度散漫 其實給不了什麼幫助。 我們一個晚上的房價約320美金 真的不知道這麼糟糕的房間怎麼會收這麼貴。

title: Good hotel, good value
text:
The hotel is very well situated, only a couple of blocks from Times Square.  The staff were extremely friendly and Marie at reception needs special mention as she went out of her way to accommodate our early arrival.  Rooms are small but comfortable and we had a great two nights.
All in all the hotel is great value compared to similar hotels in the area.  Will certainly stay here again when we return to Manhattan.

title: A perfect stay!
text: I just finished up an incredible 5 night stay on points at Marriotts TownePlace Suites at Times Square. I can not say enough good things about it! The location is so close to the theaters and right next to a subway stop. Every member of the staff was friendly and helpful. Kitchenette was well equipped, and there was a closet of additional items for loan. Our room had ample room for a queen bed and pull out twin chair/ bed. Though the carpets were worn, housekeeping did an exceptional job of thoroughly cleaning each day. We were warmly welcomed with cool bottles of water. Breakfast buffet every morning, and cold water and coffee and tea were always available. Robert at the front desk had the room decorated for my birthday. I was able to walk about 10 minutes to Whole Foods to stock up on food supplies, and I ended up making-and-taking most meals. Gym downstairs is well-lit and open around the clock. Any time I messaged the front desk through the app, I received a timely response. I will certainly be back!

title: Overprice, tiny rooms, and unfriendly hotel staff/management
text:
Rooms are rather small even for Manhattan standards, and do not quite match the pictures for the same room types show on the hotel web page.

Staff was very unaccommodating and not helpful during my stay, including the management staff, which is surprisingly not even present at the location for most of the day.

There are much better options for hotels in the same area, and even at cheaper prices, so I am sure I will not be returning to this hotel for my future stays in Manhattan.

title: Es una mentira el desayuno
text:
Bueno, lastima el desayuno. 
Escogí este hotel por la ubicación y facilidades de poder desayunar. Desafortunadamente el desayuno es un completo DESASTRE. No hay alimentos, cuando se acaban nos los reponen. Ni siquiera reponen las bebidas como el café. Un día dijeron que porque estaba muy lleno, otro día, que porque la cocina estaba dañada. En fin, nunca hubo desayuno y si pagamos este rubro dentro de la tarifa. Las habitaciones del hotel son pequeñas pero limpias, sin embargo el precio es elevado si consideramos  que no incluye el desayuno y toca salir a buscar y comprar. Que mala experiencia. Mejor no ofrezcan algo que no van a cumplir. Es una vergüenza

title: Great value for money! Nice place
text: Great value for money! The room was clean, spacious, nice breakfast and the service was very helpful. I would like to mention Ma Marie L at the front desk who gave us extraordinary service. We will certainly come back.

title: Excellent place to stay. Good size, good location
text: Very nice for a few days stay. Location about 20 mins walk from Times Square. With New York, really  depends where you want to be near to. Subway underground is literally 3 mins walk on opposite street. Room- very clean and cleaners cleaned to a very high standard. Perfect bathroom with new shower and tiles. Very comfy beds. Didn’t try the breakfast, but did use the coffee and tea in the lobby. Room size was perfect in terms of USA sized rooms and staff friendly. Only 1 big negative- lifts are a nightmare. Plan extra time whenever you need to go somewhere. I do question if they switched off 1 lift for cleaners and staff, would it move quicker for guests. Too many cleaners jumping in lifts stopping at each floor whilst guests are inside it. Not good as you get a lot of guests annoyed by it who just want to get in the lift and exit. Other than that, superb stay and would definitely recommend again.

title: Horrible customer service
text: I had a reservation for this past Friday night (5/12).  I wasn't able to go and cancelled on 4/29 which is well within the alloted cancelation window to not be charged. I woke up on Sat and checked my emails and there was a bill from the hotel and I was charged for the stay.  I called the hotel directly and after being placed on hold for over 10 minutes I was told that I needed to call back at 10 and speak with the mgr.  I called back at 10:10 when I was told "she was running late" and I'd need to call back again.  I had to leave for work so I didn't have time to do that.  I decided to call the 800 number for Marriott and have them help me.  The person I spoke with there took all my information and said he could see the cancellation in the sytem and prepared a case to send to hotel.  He told me to check back on Wed, which I did.  When I called back the person I spoke with said that the person who I originally spoke with shouldn't have taken the info as because this was a special rate I needed to deal directly with hotel.  I had to call the hotel's direct number multiple times as they had it routed to reservation line who couldn't put me directly through.  I finally after being persistent reached a woman named Marie.  I told her the problem and she said she didn't see that I had cancelled the room and that's why I was charged.  Funny that the person at Marriott was able to see it but she couldn't.  She was not a pleasant person to talk to as she condescendingly asked me if I had a cancellation email from Marriott (probably hoping I hadn't saved that.) which I had because I save evrything.  She asked me to email it to her, which I did immrediately while I was still on the phone.  I asked her how I would know it was reversed and she said she's email me.  I heard nothing all day after I spoke with her, not even confirming that she had received my email.  This morning I emailed her again (as trying to reach the hotel directly by phone is a task in itself) just asking her if she could please respond to me and confirm that she received my email and took care of this.  The whole day has passed and once again no response.  I called the Marriott 800 # back to enlist their help.  I was put on the phone with a supervisor who agreed they couldn't do anything because it was the type of rate I needed to take care of with hotel directly.  I reminded her that that is why I'm calling because they are not responding to me.  She called hotel directly for me and gave me the name of front desk person she spoke with who said he will bring it to attention of mgmnt and get it resolved, I'm hoping this happens as I have spent far too much time on trying to resolve an error on the part of the hotel.  I understand that mistakes happen but the fact that there was no effort or communications trying to resolve this has me not very happy.

title: Comfortable property !
text: Very friendly staff.. helpful and pleasant . Cozy room with comfortable bed. Breakfast was good with great variety. Limited seating but we took our food up to our room one of our four mornings as it was busy. We felt very comfortable and safe here . Ideal location just off 8th street.  Close to restaurants, subway, shops and Broadway Times Square area.

title: Safe & clean - exceeded expectations
text: I recently took my teen daughter on a girls trip to NY and ended up booking this hotel because: we were taking a red eye into JFK and the hotel guaranteed they could store our luggage, this hotel is extremely close to the Majestic Theater where we planned to see Phantom of the Opera, other reviews commented on how safe this hotel felt which made me feel better as a complete suburbanite traveling with a teen, Well this hotel surpassed our expectations entirely! The lobby team was so friendly and helpful - from the very beginning! When we arrived it was Sunday morning so my only expectation was to have our luggage held since it was so early but we were actually able to get our room! Wow! Never had that happen before and it was so appreciated as the teen promptly fell asleep. The room was clean ( I like to wipe down surfaces on arrival). The kitchenette wasn’t something we needed other than using the fridge but I could see how it’d come in handy for a longer stay. Breakfast was a nice bonus and that too was even better than I expected. Each morning they had a rotation that included some sort of hot carb (French toast, waffle or pancake), some sort of meat (sausage or bacon), some sort of egg (tiny egg bites, egg circles) along with other food options like yogurt and oatmeal. Definitely came in clutch but it was best to get there on the earlier side to have the most options although the staff did refill hit items periodically. Safety wise I felt absolutely fine - they do have someone standing at the door mid afternoon onward to let people in (or you could use your card key). The neighborhood wasn’t terrible either as you’re still very much in a touristy area with Birdland across the street and another hotel next door. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Great location and staff, but needs life support
text:
Hotel rooms were small, as expected in the city. Hotel was conveniently located near Time Square. Staff was very friendly. That said, breakfast was simply dreadful. No toaster for toast or bagel, no butter or cream cheese! The hotel room AC was not working in rooms 214/216 and they were 78 degrees while we stayed which is not comfortable. There was no pantry to purchase even waters. The breakfast area is tiny and likely won't find a free table but given my experience, eat somewhere else. The parking garage to the right was not good, they valet' us and killed our battery and that was a whole other issue. There was no discount for using them and the staff was terrible. 

That said, I could still recommend the hotel on attitude and location alone. The beds were also comfortable and water pressure was solid.

title: Will definitely stay here again
text: Great location, super friendly staff. Robert checked us in quickly and found a room early so we could get out on the town right away. Offered to keep our bags after checkout while we went to lunch. Clean and spacious!

title: Ottima posizione per il resto👎🏻
text: Sicuramente si trova in un’ottima posizione 5 min a piedi da Time Square. Per il resto camera piccolissima x 3 persone . Bisognava scavalcare i letti per arrivare al bagno. Non c’era posto per appoggiare i vestiti.Il bagno invece era abbastanza grande. Struttura pulita. Colazione praticamente nulla abbiamo provato a scendere in vari orari dalla mattina alle 7.30 o alle 9.30 c’era solo caffè latte e acqua calda . dicevano sempre che era finito tutto (alle 8.00 del mattino?!)

title: Nice hotel in the Theater and Times Square area.
text: Right smack in the downtown area with easy access to the Theater District and Times Square. The rooms are small, as expected, and parking is offsite but close by. We were greeted by Robert at the desk and it was a great start to a great stay. Robert was friendly and knowledgeable about the area. He gave us great advice and was just so pleasant to talk to also. I would stay here again as the rooms were clean and nice, albeit small due to the location. It was priced more reasonably than many of the alternatives and was a win overall.

title: Enjoyable stay!
text:
Robert el chico de recepción super amable y encantador, todo el tiempo dispuesto a dar buen servicio.
El hotel en si es acogedor y está en una buena ubicación por lo que puedes ir caminando sin problemas.

title: Decent Hotel / Amazing Staff
text: My son and I sent 3 nights at TownePlace. The are is good, close to Times Square and public transportation. The hotel itself was pretty good. There were a few issues during our stay. We had to switch rooms almost immediately as we were giving a room with a locked bathroom that was unable to open. The new room’s bathroom dirt worked well, but the lock for the room door had issues. We had to reconnect our keys almost every time we wanted to enter our room. Lots of trips to the lobby and back. The elevator was also out of order for almost a day while we were there too. All of that said, the staff is so kind and welcoming, they made up for the room/hotel issues. Robert was very friendly and made us feel like family from the moment we walked in the door. If we ever stay at this hotel again, it will be because of the warm and friendly staff.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: We stayed in this hotel after coming over to NYC from England. Robert and other staff were amazing during our stay, doing everything they could for us. They are always smiling, making you laugh, and being a pleasure to be around, on the last day Robert even asked us for help on where he should plant trees outside, he is a character. Breakfast was delicious and room 607 was perfect too. We will be back as soon as we can.

title: Excellent!!
text: This hotel is great , well located and the service is awesome. Robert at the front  desk he  is the best!!! He is well experienced on sights/ locations and customer service , I loved the stay in this hotel 100% recommended

title: Enjoyable stay, nice location
text:
This hotel is located in a great location for our purpose. Steps away from Times Square and on the same street as a train stop so you can get to the underground metro quickly for exploring other places in the area. The day staff ladies were friendly and courteous. Although our rooms were not ready upon check in, the staff did their best to accommodate us quickly and efficiently so we didn’t lose time waiting around. 
The rooms are lovely and functional. The nice feature at these suites for someone with a child or staying more than one night is the small kitchenette to prepare a baby bottle / food for picky children/ or a meal. No where to sit and eat! The kitchenette is equipped with almost anything you can think of. Forks / knives/ hot plate/ skillet/ wine opener! 
Breakfast was included in the room rate. It was a small breakfast area but very lovely. And because it’s not too big , you know it’s fresh because it’s constantly getting refilled. They have an option to make your own waffles. And coffe and tea service all day. 
It rained while we were there and the staff was kind enough to lend us an umbrella from the hotel. Very conviene when l

title: Wonderful 🙆‍♀️
text:
Wonderful experience, the hotel is in walking distance from everything, nice room with everything is needed, the crew were so nice, especially Robert that was helpful and kind 😇 
With any doubts, I will return to that hotel in the next times
Enjoy 😊

title: Excellent !
text: Excellent ! Accueil, serviabilité, emplacement, équipement de la chambre, propret, tout été parfait. Je reviendrais volontiers. Merci à Robert, Modesto et leur très professionnelle manager pour leur aide et la qualité de leur accueil ainsi qu'à tout le reste de leur équipe pour leur professionnalisme et gentillesse.

title: The heart of Broadway
text: Great location and super close to all things Broadway. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Staff is over and above especially Robert who was able to get in into our room early after taking red eye. Thank you!

title: 15 días en NYC
text:
Nuestra estadía fue confortable durante las 2 semanas que estuvimos allí. Muy cómoda la habitación, bien la limpieza y excelente Modesto y Robert quienes con su cordialidad respondían a nuestras requerimientos.
La ubicación del hotel permite estar cerca de todo ya sea caminando y con transporte público. 
Hablan español.

title: Successful NYC trip
text: The room was spacious for what I was expecting of NYC. That was a nice surprise. The front desk was super welcoming. Robert was really helpful during our checkout.  I would definitely return here in the future.

title: Nice hotel, even nicer staff!
text:
Went to NYC with a group of friends and decided to stay in this hotel. I genuinely think this is a great location if you plan on exploring the touristy areas of Midtown and the surrounding areas. Also if you would like to utilize the Long stay style of the rooms (Kitchenette with microwave, mini-fridge, etc.) and enjoy complimentary coffee throughout the day as well as breakfast in the morning. While the rooms themselves aren't anything the write home about (They aren't bad, just not special), the location is top notch and the hospitality from the staff was out of this world!

A 5 minute walk to Times Square, a short walk to the subway entrance, multiple paths from the subway to Grand Central station as well as Downtown, Brooklyn, etc. A jazz club right outside  across the street as well as a Japanese BBQ place (Gyukaku). There are plenty of local coffee places around as well if the comp coffee at the hotel isn't to your liking. There are Broadway shows a plenty in the surrounding area, activities, you name it.

The best thing about this hotel for me was the staff though. Robert, Andrise and Yarellyn were fantastic staff members that made us feel welcome every time we came in from our adventures! It all started with Robert who, when we arrived, was able to accommodate my multiple requests at arrival and the whole time conversated with us about what were we planning on doing in New York. It turns out Robert was also from my hometown as well! (Small world). Andrise was a bundle of joy everytime we passed, always greeting us and asking if we needed anything at all. Yarellyn was also very social and really made us feel welcome towards the later nights. All three show absolute professionalism when needed but also showed the casual side for fun enjoyable conversation. Not a single person here at this hotel, made us feel like we were not welcome to be there.

If I return the NYC, I will definitely consider returning to this property!

title: Uma ótima equipe faz a diferença.
text: Só queria dizer que tive uma ótima estadia. A equipe foi incrível - Iara e Weri. A equipe do hoteis.com também foi ótima - Giovanna e Brenda. Pudemos fazer um check-in antecipado e isso fez toda a diferença. O café da manhã não era muito diversificado, mas bom. O quarto com cozinha foi realmente uma bênção. Mais uma vez agradeço a equipe do hoteis.com e TownePlace Suites. Eu retornarei.

title: The staff
text: Just wanted to say i had a great stay. The staff was awesome. The staff was great. Just wanted to say thanks to the following staff that made the stay great. Andise , Natasha, Modesto and Yarellyn. These employees were great. And again thank you very much. I will be back again

title: Great staff but don't stay on 1st floor
text: The front desk personnel were so energetic and friendly, asking everyone what they're going to do that day or if they are having a good time in the city. Unfortunately we got assigned the worst room in the hotel, 105. Every person who is in the left tower has to pass by this room and all the others on the first floor to get to the elevator. What's worse is that there is a tiled ramp near 105, so the noisy rolling of suitcases competes with everyone's loud voices to get the "keep Room 105 guests awake" award. We also had family on the 6th floor which was super-quiet. Both rooms had sliding bathroom doors with gaps so you could see in from certain angles, which is awkward when traveling with your children or friends. Anyway, breakfast was good and the location great.

title: Wouldn’t go back …
text:
Great location. Well appointed rooms despite being a bit tight for spaces but we expected this.

Lifts were terrible. Often waited 15 mins or more to get down- so ended up walking 22 floors most days. 

Breakfast was awful. Paper plates, cups and bowls and plastic cutlery. Everything in plastic. Not a care for the environment! Complete carnage too- very difficult to get a table, and huge queues for the toaster. 

Front desk service was hit and miss. 

We did have a view of One World Trade Centre from one room and a partial view of the ESB from the other though!

title: Great place to stay near Times Square and Theater District
text: We enjoyed spending the night here.  We saw Phantom of the Opera, which was about a 3 minute walk from the hotel - so convenient, and so much more affordable than the Marriott Marquis or the Intercontinental.  Service was very friendly at check-in and check-out.  Rooms were small, but had everything you need.  WiFi worked well and was free.  Pull out sleeper sofa was a chair, not a couch, and so slept only one person.

title: Sightseeing Christmas Trip
text:
Myself & my 17 yr old daughter stayed here for 5 nights (13-18 Dec).  We wanted a hotel that had a great location for a reasonable price without any heafty resort fee that seemed obligatory in alot of NYC hotels.  This was perfect!  Location is super handy for Times Square & subway stations (but we tended to walk everywhere).  Room was completely sufficient for our needs, clean, good hot water, comfy bed & small kitchen facilities, we didnt need anymore than that.  The breakfast was ample, excellent selection of cereals, fruit, drinks & selected hot bits too.  There was always hot drinks available in reception.  Thats brings me to reception - amazing staff, always so helpful, happy & accommodating, especially Natasha who was always interested in what we had been up to - we have travelled alot & your staff are some of the best we have encountered!
So in conclusion would stay again - definitely!! (2 very happy Brits!)

title: We had a great time staying here. It was super clean. All the staff was great and super helpful. Breakfast was great
text: We had a great time. The hotel was very clean, staff was very nice. We had a room with a kitchenette. It was nice and spacious. We would definitely stay here again. The hotel was close to everything we wanted to do so we did a lot of walking. Breakfast was great as well

title: Great location
text:
Marriott ambassador elite. The best three things about this  hotel is the location, the friendly staff & the price. Downsides : the elevator is SUPER slow. No extra blankets (called for 2 & after waiting more than an hour, called back we received a thin
duvet cover — definitely not a blanket. We went to Target two blocks away & purchased a blanket. The rooms (711 & 709) were both noisy.  We had heavy rain for 24 hours during over visit & the window in room 711 was leaking.  The room is on the smaller side without a lot of storage but it was fine for two people. No bathtub (shower only!) but the hot water was super hot = pleasant surprise.

title: Experience Third-World Amenities without Leaving NYC!
text: First the good:  The staff were lovely and accommodating and well-organized.  Their place of business was not.    We were booked for a five-night stay and checked out after one.  Our studio (described to us as the best in the hotel) was off a warren of tiny hallways,  so OK, because we had a ground level room with a tiny patio--as reserved.  The room itself had almost no light--just two mismatched bedside lamps, that's it--no ceiling illumination (unless you counted the entry hall light which switched off on a timer very  5 minutes).  The kitchenette was well-equipped, with a tiny oval table, presumably to sit and eat--but not a chair in the room., nor was there a coffee table next to the sofa bed (e.g., to sit and eat there).  No drawers to unpack.  An open bookcase-type 'closet', placed to partly block clear access to the (leaky) patio door furnished with two faded lawn sofas.  Bathroom, actually quite nice for a tiny NYC hotel.  And the 'best' part?  Room rate range of $550- $695/ night.  Who planned this place???

title: TownePlace Suites New york Times square-awesome
text: Very comfortable.  Nice and delicious fully cooked breakfast. Nice hotel staff. It had an apartment feel. Nice kitchenette.  Nice solo stove. Beautiful bathroom. We could get seconds of the food. Nice hotel travelers. Loved the fact you can watch internet TV such as YouTube on your TV free and not have to login to your YouTube account from home.

title: Love NYC
text: Very friendly staff, great gym. Staff quickly addressed a problem with our reservation and was luckily able to come later needs.. Nicest rooms have stayed in New York City. Breakfast was not that great but there's plenty of delicious places right outside. Even had a patio 😊

title: Overall good stay
text:
We were given an accessible room in the back of the hotel (facing the 43rd st) looking at a construction site. Since we were out a lot, the view didn't bother us, but we were concerned about possible noise. Luckily, it was quiet maybe because we were there on Sat and Sun only.  The room was clean and modern, but the top kitchen cupboards were hung way too low, making it difficult to access the water faucet or coffee maker. Also, the rod in the wardrobe closet was installed so low that there wasn't enough height for jackets or shirts. I assume these are unique to our room as it was an accessible room but I don't know for sure.

The breakfast was adequate, not great. I'm not a big fan of pre-packaged breakfast sandwiches and such, but I enjoyed coffee and pastries. Also, the dining area was rather small and definitely didn't have enough tables to accommodate the size of the hotel.  

There were a few minor issues, but overall I liked  the TownePlace Suites. It is a clean and modern hotel conveniently located near Times Square. The room size isn't too bad for NYC and having a kitchenette is special. It's a great choice for anyone who is looking for a mid-range hotel in a great location for sightseeing.

title: Find Robert when you get there. He’s the best!
text: My stay in New York was very pleasant to say the least. I was very happy with the service at the hotel and I can easily say I will make my way there again soon. Robert made everything seamless! He’s the MVP!

title: Great location and quiet
text: This hotel has a great location, very close to Times Square but far enough so there is no noise in the rooms.  It is very modern and the beds comfortable and bathroom luxurious for a hotel of this caliber.  The rooms are a decent size for NYC but there is no desk or table.  It’s interesting that there’s almost a full kitchen but nowhere to eat.  I did not have the breakfast as it was all sugary carbs and the hot items were Jimmy Dean sandwiches in packaging.  Staff was very friendly and gave me a late checkout. I would stay here again given what you get for the price.

title: Great everything other than elevator
text: Great hotel for the price. Clean and new and in a nice area. The biggest complaint I have though is the elevator. If you leave around 9am and don’t stay above 40th floor, it will take at least 20 minutes to find a not completely full elevator to come down. Management needs to fix it. Either split the four elevators by floor or find other solutions, but definitely frustrating.

title: Great hotel in great location!
text:
Booked at the very last minute and was very happy with my stay. Through no fault of the hotels, I had a small issue when I checked in. Robert J was not only very friendly, he was very understanding and patient while he helped me resolve the problem.  Every employee I encountered during my stay was very friendly and welcoming. 

Although the rooms are small (as most are in Manhattan) it was clean and comfortable. 

The location is a couple blocks away from Times Square and very close to the Broadway theaters.

Thanks Townplace Suites team for a very enjoyable stay!  Hope to see you again soon!

title: Incredible Staff and  NYC location
text:
We were given a handicapped accessible room. I was sort of okay with it. However, we didn't realize that across the way there would be construction all night long. I didn't sleep well at all. The next morning, I asked the staff if we could please move. I thought for sure they would deny my request. The front desk staff was absolutely AMAZING! Marie, Natasha, Cristal and Robert were the best ever! They kept our luggage safe until another room opened up. It was nice and quiet and I got a great night's sleep! Everytime we went by the front desk staff, they were super friendly. They were very helpful with all of our tourist questions, too. They went out of their way to appreciate us being there! If I ever go back to NYC, I will always stay here!

The hotel was SPOTLESS as well as our room. Very comfy bed and roomy shower. 

The location was fantastic...just a short walk to Times Square. 

Just up the street was Carmines...Incredible Italian food!!!!

title: Que du bonheur 😍
text:
Excellent séjour dans cet hôtel. Notre studio était encore mieux qu'en photo !! Chambre spacieuse, lit douillet, petite banquette, kitchenette bien équipée, salle de bains au top 👍 
Le buffet de petit-déjeuner était toujours délicieux et varié : yaourts, jus de fruits divers, viennoiseries, muffins, cookies, corn-flakes, granola, porridge, fruits frais, graines, fruits secs, gaufres de Liège, gâteaux, barres de céréales... et même des hamburgers ! On s'est bien régalé chaque matin, c'était toujours un véritable plaisir !
Nous avons été chaleureusement accueillis par le staff, toujours agréable et disponible + mention spéciale pour le personnel d'entretien qui fait son travail avec rigueur !
Il y a une grande terrasse confortable sur le toit de l'hôtel, avec barbecues high-tech à disposition. C'était très appréciable d'y prendre notre dîner le soir après une grosse journée !
L'emplacement de l'hôtel est parfait, à deux pas de Times Square, du métro, et de nombreuses attractions.
En bref, nous avons adoré ces deux semaines au TownePlace Suites By Marriott, et nous en garderons un très beau souvenir. 
Encore merci à toute l'équipe pour son investissement, sa gentillesse et sa bonne humeur 🥰🙏🙏 

Carla & Jérémy

title: Great staff & location
text:
The staff of this hotel and the location of it is great. A special thanks and appreciation to:
Front desk: Cristal & Robert
Housekeeping: Juan, Yohanna
Many thanks to each of you for being such excellent service to my family and I.

Things to improve and what I found Hotels weakness: pictures and descriptions of their room website are deceiving. They are really in need for update on that. 
Their breakfast area can be bigger and with a little more variety. 
They should have all day coffee in the lobby area like the majority of the Towneplace suites. 
The rooms on first floor should have some kind of sound proof so guests don’t hear every sound from outside and the hallway. 
The sofa bed should be most comfortable and the bathroom can use more storage space and towel hanger. 
The elevator is slow

It would help if you have a mini market at the lobby for sale. 

You have a station bear by
Restaurants 
Broadway area
Time square

title: Très bien situé
text: Chambre petite mais suffisante, propre et avec un coin cuisine. Personnel très sympathique et disponible. Le petit-déjeuner n´est pas exceptionnel mais offert ! Super bien situé a 2 minutes de Time square !

title: Good location
text: We were placed on the first floor in NYC and I was afraid of the street level noise but the room faced a courtyard in the back so noise wasn’t a problem! Tiny room and nowhere for hubby to work remotely or place to put suitcases but great location for plays! Decent breakfast too

title: Bon hôtel en globalité
text:
Les points positifs : 
-L’hotel est très propre, moderne et confortable et le personnel est gentil, accueillant et souriant. 
-La localisation est parfaite pour aller à broadway le soir 
-La chambre est assez grande, propre et on dispose de toutes les nécessités, de plus le ménage est fait sans faute tout les 3 jours. 
-Le petit déjeuner compris dans le prix permet de tenir au corps jusqu’au midi

Les points négatifs : 
-Le petit déjeuner est correct mais il est composé principalement d’éléments assez gras et très sucré dont nous n’avons pas forcément l’habitude en france au petit déjeuner même si c’est le jeu quand on va à l’étranger aussi
-Le quartier, même si bien pour broadway, reste un peu mal fréquenté et on peut se sentir en insécurité parfois, de plus il est très bruyant même si on s’y attend forcément en étant à times square 
-L’ascenseur est vraiment très lent et il faut s’armer de patience 

Malgré les quelques points négatifs cela reste un bon hôtel qu’on recommanderait car il n’y a rien de grave !

title: Average but clean hotel
text: Average hotel in the Times Square area. All of the hotels in the Bryant Park/Times Square Area were over $400 per night over the dates I needed. Later found out it was NYU graduation. This was only $239. Room was clean and modern with a kitchenette and floor to ceiling windows . No housekeeping services. Bathroom was small with a small sink area, fine for one person.  No desk or chair so not ideal for a business traveler. Had to sit on the edge of the bed to work on this very small end table, very awkward. Request a room away from the elevator. It was very loud and very slow. Front desk staff was super nice. Breakfast was included.

title: Great location and staff
text: Stayed in the hotel right after it was opened for the first time and have warm memories. Very friendly staff who allowed us to change our stay dates with a very short notification time. The breakfast selection was nice, room quiet and clean

title: Perfect in every way
text:
Excellent location if you love Broadway shows and staying near Times Square.  Check in and out was easy and all the front desk staff should be applauded for their nice, friendly demeanour.  Rarely do you see such lovely welcoming staff especially Cristal.  Breakfast was average but great that its included in the price., a rare find in NYC.
Rooms are small but normal for New York.  Clean and modern with enough towels for all.  Great showers which is important to me with lots of hot water.
I’ll be visiting again, especially with a fair price.

title: There is better out there
text: This is a well located and clean establishment, very convenient for theaters and activities. But the whole experience left us wishing we had booked elsewhere. We are accustomed to small hotel rooms in NYC, and for just two people it would be okay, but we got it because it was a "suite" with a fold out sofa bed for our 9 year old daughter. First, the fold out was awful. She managed to sleep without complaint, but there is no way an adult could bear the thin "mattress" that is the bed. Second, there was construction (jack hammering?) starting at 7 am and continuing until 6 pm everyday but Sunday. Third, when we flushed our toilet, it made a horrible banging sort of noise. When we informed the staff we were told that maintenance would't touch the toilet, told that by the maintenance person who was standing there. A simple "We'll look into it" would have sufficed, but they wanted to argue that we were wrong. We were told upon arrival that we only got housekeeping after three days, and I must say that I never once saw any housekeeping staff during the whole of our three days. So no fresh towels, trash emptying, bed making or even checking in. There were plenty of other hotels with similar prices at which we could have stayed, and we now wish we had chosen better. Not much better than a hostel, I'd say.

title: Bem legal
text:
Hotel bem informal !  Localização muito boa, perto de tudo, metrô, restaurantes, mercadinhos e lojas em geral. 
Staff da recepção super atencioso, sempre com boa vontade em ajudar, destaque para o recepcionista Robert que é muito ágil e querido!
Apartamento bem completo, com cozinha completa , com utensílios, papel toalha e até detergente para lavar louça. 
Wi-Fi de alta velocidade grátis. 
Café da manhã poderia ser melhor, falta algo salgado para comer. 
Banho excelente! Janelas com ótimo isolamento acústico. 
Tamanho do quarto também é bom.

title: Estupendo!
text:
Muy recomendable. Habitaciones, baños, cocina y pasillos muy limpios. Todo bastante moderno. Te proporcionan toallas y jabones y te limpian la habitación cada tres días. En la propia habitación hay una mini cocina muy equipada. 

A pesar de estar en el centro de la ciudad y a cinco minutos de Times Square no había ruidos. 

Desayuno disponible durante tres horas, con muchas opciones: Leche, café, zumos, fruta, magdalenas, croissant, barritas, donuts... 

El trato con los huéspedes es excepcional, siempre atentos y tratando de ayudar en todo. En concreto, José Ariel, muy atento y siempre dando sugerencias para conocer mejor la ciudad. 

El único problema es que hay un único ascensor, pero no nos afectó tanto ya que gran parte del tiempo estábamos en la ciudad.

title: This is the place to be It was close to everything Close to Penn station to Macy's  The number 1 train down town  is 400 feet to
text: The hotel was in a great location, close to everything near the train station ,close to shopping,  Breakfast was out of this world staff was amazing friendly  Especially loved the small kitchen in the room and 24 hour fitness center The room was very spacious they even had a toaster in the room I'll definitely be back A quick shout to the  hotel staff thank you 😊

title: Good location friendly people
text:
The location is excellent if you are going to musicals.
Place is very clean, friendly people and price is ok for New York..
But construction noise is bad ( we were in South Tower) hopefully it is temporary!
Other than that, we enjoyed our stay in NY very much :) 
Small Italian restaurant 2 mns walking very good :)

title: Good choice for this neighborhood
text: Overall I enjoyed my 2 night stay. Rate was a deal and the room had a mini kitchen with coffee. The bathroom/room was bigger than most in nyc and clean. Staff I encountered were very kind. The negative was construction nearby that had a thudding one of the morning’s by 730 AM that even my white noise app couldn’t wash out. The room was also kind of dim, but manageable. Plenty of great food and bars all around. And of course all the shows are in your immediate vicinity.  Good choice for this area.

title: Don't stay in the "Cellar"
text:
We stayed in the Marriott for a Valentines weekend outing. The hotel is located near many Broadway theaters and restaurants. The staff was very helpful but the room we were given was on the C (cellar) level. That is below street level. Despite one wall being almost floor to ceiling glass, the room was very dark. There was a patio outside but there were no chairs in the room so we couldn't sit outside. The room did have a kitchenette and a comfortable bed. The free continental breakfast was very good.
Due to its excellent location, I'd stay at the Marriott again. Just not in the cellar.

title: Bien
text:
Petit hôtel extrêmement bien placé à côté de Times Square. Un personnel agréable, souriant, disponible et gentil.
Chambre propre et bien équipée. Le ménage est fait tous les 3 jours mais il suffit de demander pour que les serviettes soit changée et les poubelles vidées,
