Le seul point négatif est le petit déjeuner…. Il est inexistant ! Pas de gaufres, pas de salé, pas de toast…. Des minis croissants, yaourts, café… ça dépanne mais c est pas un petit déjeuner.

title: Tiny. Unsafe. Unresponsive Staff. Loud
text: People in room next to us robbed. Stuff stolen out of their room. We were kept up ALL night by police investigation.Asked front desk to move. Manager never contacted us. Stopped by front desk 3 times. They did nothing. Unsafe. Loud. Unresponsive

title: Pleasant stay
text:
Very well located hotel with many stores near the hotel.
Nice and clean rooms and bathrooms.
As there was a construction behind the building, it was a little bit noisy.
At the lobby, Isaac and Andrise were very helpful when I needed assistance with my bag the day I checked out.
Totally recommended.

title: Great service
text: Perfect location  very clean , very friendly stuff also Ask for Isaac he took very good care of me , he was very professional , they have a good breakfast with good croissants , fruits , cereals. The room are equipped with microwave no need to go downstairs and you also have a fridge + a strove. The perfect room to feel like home ;)

title: Great customer service
text: Isaac was amazing, super friendly, very help and polite, great customer service. The hotels rooms are a little small but it very confortable If it is for a couple.  Very comfortable and clean. The ubicación is great, very close to the tourist areas

title: Disapointment
text:
I was booked to stay 3 nights at Townplaces Suites by Marriott in Times Square, however I was informed that the hotel couldn't accommodate  my reservation a few minutes before check-in, and I was relocated to the Hilton Garden Inn.

Firstly, the check-in took about 35min without the agent at the front desk letting me know what was going on, didn't offer water or explanation, when she finally proceeded to check-in kept talking with the colleague next to her ignoring me and my husband. Secondly I booked a room with a King Size bed and we got a tiny room with 2 double beds, nothing was explained at check-in what was included, if we could take water, how the shop worked, nothing at all. Also the main reason to book the first hotel was the kitchenette so imagine my disappointment when I got to the hotel I didn't book and all we had was a small refrigerator. Lastly, I know this is not a luxury hotel but when I simply asked a gentleman at reception where would be the closest location to do a covid test, his answer was "Oh I don't know, google it". 
I work at a front desk myself and I know this behavior is not up to anyone's standards.

title: Excellent stay and friendly staff made it happen
text: "Isaac was an amazing host. He was very attentive to my needs during my stay. He was well informed of the amenities and services the hotel offered. He also pays attention to detail in assigning the right kind of room suitable to my needs. Isaac's approach to his work is an SI unit of hospitality!

title: Top!!!
text:
Das Hotel liegt mit seinen wenigen Gehminuten top zentral dem Times Square und sämtlichen anderen Sehenswürdigkeiten in Manhattan zum Greifen nahe. Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit kleiner Küchenzeile, die gut ausgestattet ist (Kühlschrank, Mikrowelle, Kaffeemaschine, 2 Herdplatten, Töpfe, Teller Besteck, Tassen, etc. ist alles vorhanden!), selbst Bügelbrett und Bügeleisen waren dabei. Den Föhn habe ich dummerweise erst am letzten Tag entdeckt, aber es gibt ihn in einem schwarzen Beutel im Schrank :)
Das Zimmer lag nach hinten heraus und war dementsprechend erstaunlich ruhig. Einzig die Lüftung war mir etwas zu laut, aber das war mit Ohropax schon nicht mehr hörbar. 
Das Personal war super freundlich und gut gelaunt, und das Frühstück hatte im Grunde alles, was man braucht. Es gab Oat Meal mit Toppings, verschiedene Kelloggs mit Milch, Croissants, andere kleine Backwaren, Muffins, Joghurt und Obst. Das tolle ist, dass sogar kleine Lunchtüten dort bereit liegen, sodass man sich noch Verpflegung für den Tag einpacken kann, ohne ein schlechtes Gewissen zu haben! Der Kaffee schmeckt großartig, und auch Wasser und Orangensaft kann man sich dort abfüllen und für den Tag mitnehmen.
Besondere Corona Regeln sind wie üblich - Maske in der Lobby, im Fahrstuhl und in den Fluren, Impfnachweis wurde abgefragt und Flächen wurden häufig desinfiziert. 
Alles in allem top Hotel und absolut zu empfehlen, für Menschen die Wert auf eine zentrale Lage legen.

title: Isaac at reception rocks it
text: Arrived at 8am after a red eye flight and Isaac went above and beyond to allow an early check in. I didn’t expect it as the check in time is 4pm - he is a very kind individual and puts his guests first. He acknowledges Marriott Status. The property is very centrally located and offers small studios or other room types with a kitchen. It has a grab and go style breakfast and has locked doors which you access with your key for your protection. It’s people like Isaac who make traveling a pleasure and management needs to recognize his professionalism and hospitality.

title: Great Location and clean.
text: Stayed here for our recent trip to New York. A great location if you want to be in the heart of Times Square. Most attractions and shopping are a 5-15 min walk away.  Clean rooms with microwaves, fridge, 2 electric burner cooktops, dishes, and dishwasher.  No daily room cleaning, however anything you need just ask and, they brought to you.  You can't just walk in off the street.  You needed your room key to enter or someone had to let you in. What you expect from a Marriott brand hotel.

title: Great location and service
text: Hotel is awesome!!!Special kudos to Isaac for an amazing service. He ensured quick checking in process and provided great service over phone later. I would recommend him for any hospitality service!!’

title: perfect location; spacious rooms; awesome breakfast
text: We stayed here in November 2021 to visit our daughter, who lives in NYC. You simply cannot beat this location because it is close to everything! Easy to walk to Broadway, Central Park,Columbus Circle (and a Whole Foods on the lower level!),  High Line, Upper West Side, and 5th Avenue! It’s a great value for the money, especially with the breakfast buffet. And how fantastic is it to have a kitchen while in NYC! The staff are all wonderful and very helpful. I had a small issue with the room and they went above and beyond to make sure it got fixed. We will definitely book this hotel again for our next trip to NYC! This is now our “home away from home” when we visit the Big Apple!

title: Great place
text: Isaac and Ross were super friendly and extremely helpful when we needed assistance. Highly recommend. Great location and the room was very clean.  Walking distance to everything we wanted to do and see.

title: November 2021 Vacation
text:
Originally we had a reservation for the new Towneplace Suites in Chelsea but it  was canceled a week before our trip so we switched to Times Square, unfortunately ended up costing us $300 more. The location was good. In the heart of the theater district with 2 coffee shops on the street, shake shack on the corner and a ton more restaurants on 9th street. The room is nice, no real closet and a very small(kinda useless) couch. With a kitchenette you would hope for some kind of table but any meals we prepared were eaten on the bed unfortunately. The bathroom is very nice with a lot of shelf space above the toilet and under the sink. Be prepared for an extremely slow elevator and stairs are not a option(we tried taking them down for breakfast but there’s no lobby stairs entrance, goes to the outside in an emergency exit). Breakfast was a build your own bag breakfast; included oranges, a few oatmeal options, packaged croissants and muffins, yogurts and coffee. House keeping comes every 3 days and lastly no luggage holds so if you have a late flight your check out day be prepared to have your luggage with you around the city or head to the airport early. We were able to request a checkout for 1pm but of course is not guaranteed pending reservations. 

Airport tip: flew into Newark and the easiest/cheapest way to get into the city was taking the Coach USA bus. You can buy a round trip ticket for $30 online or pay $18.50 cash to the bus driver and it drops off/picks up at the Port Authority which is a few blocks away.

title: Exceeding Marriott’s Service Standards
text:
The rooms were clean and comfortable; the service was perfect, and every request was accommodated instantly.  

These couple of years has been tough on the hospitality business; travel interruptions, followed by lack of help and the mess in the supply chain, have made life very difficult, if not impossible. 

There are very few hotels like the TownePlace by Marriott at 44th Street that, 
despite all hardships, keep the ship afloat and operate it smoothly. So my hats off to all employees and the management of the Towneplace. They are doing a fantastic job.

title: Phenomenal Hotel
text: We stayed here while visiting to see a Broadway play. The rooms were clean and spacious for NYC. The service was beyond phenomenal. José made sure the breakfast area had everything we needed and it was clean. He even stood in the middle of the street to hail us a taxi. The receptionist and all other staff were respectful and professional. Housekeeping found my iPad and ensured it was safe as they waited for me to reply to their email. So, they are also honest people. The location is minutes from Time Square, Broadway, and wonderful outdoor seated restaurants on the opposite street from Time Square. Everything was just superb and we will be back really soon.

title: Convenient, clean and quiet
text: Stayed here one night on a trip along the East Coast. The bed was comfortable, everything was clean and in good repair, and the ladies at the front desk were pleasant and friendly. No coffee or food available for breakfast, but for $150 in NYC, I'm not complaining.

title: Great place so close to everything!
text: So conveniently located! 2 blocks from Time Square and steps away from subway station. We couldn’t believe how quiet the room was! Small but well organized room with fridge and kitchen necessities. Wilfredo at the front desk was so helpful and made great restaurant recommendations. He was very friendly and always greeted us with a smile. He is exactly who you want representing the company. Breakfast to go was helpful - juice, granola bar, and yogurt. Price was reasonable and we would definitely stay here again!

title: Pleasant stay
text: I just completed an overnight stay at the Towneplace Suites Times Square and had a pleasant experience. From check-in to check-out, the staff were courteous and polite.  The hotel is located in a convenient location, about 15 minute walk from Penn Station for those traveling via Amtrak. Some services have been suspended due to COVID-19 but should be available again in the near future. The room was comfortable with a kitchenette which was convenient. I would stay again.

title: Not a good experience
text: The hotel offers no amenities at this time due to Covid. No housekeeping, no food, essentially no reason to stay here rather than an Airbnb. There is one elevator and it is extremely slow. While there is gym access, it is a tiny room and staff constantly come in and out of it as a storage room is used within in. They often leave housekeeping materials in the middle of the gym. I was told by several staff members to move when I was in the gym because I was in their way. There were a lot of suspicious people in the lobby when I was there over the weekend. One woman was drinking out of a full bottle of whiskey and not dressed in a way that I would have been comfortable with children. There was a large group of drunk and high people who came in asking the front desk for a room to party for the night when I returned to the hotel one night. I found the hotel convenient and the room slightly larger than others I had stayed in while in NYC but I would not return to the location as I felt security and lack of amenities were an issue, and there are simply better alternatives

title: THANK YOU CRIS AND WILSON!!!
text: Stayed at this location for a few nights. The room was everything i expected from what i read in the description and pictures. The staff was amazing and always helpful. CRIS was always on point with how she greeted me and was very attentive. checking up on how my stay was going. WILSON was always available and never took long to deliver whatever i needed. Thank you again for making my stay wonderful. I will be back.

title: Closed roof top
text: Stayed here for four days.  The room was clean and the staff was great.  Stayed on the first floor but it was a little loud.  Being a platinum member, we asked for an upgrade but they said there were none.  Even though there were rooms with patios not being used.    My biggest pet peeve is that the roof top was closed.   I asked the person at the front desk and he told me because of COVID.  This makes absolutely no sense.  It's 70 degrees out and I'm forced to have a cocktail in my small room.  Even the lobby is closed.

title: Great Service 🤍
text: The moment we arrived, Wilfredo made my mother and I feel so welcome. He was so nice every time I bother him with my mother requests. He is the best! We travel often to NY and this was the first time we stayed at this location and I can say that the service that we received was one of the best. Will be choosing this location again!

title: Amazing Staff
text: Checked in on November 22nd.  Ariel and Darren were amazing. Loved our room and especially loved the friendliness and courtesy I received from the staff. I highly recommend this hotel, and when I return in the summer, this will be the hotel I will be staying at.

title: Not desireable
text: Noisy room at 2 am staff did nothing about it. Finally asked for room change, reluctantly staff made the change at 2 am !!!  Room flooring was buckling. bedcover dirty, carpet stains. You get 1 towel No breakfast as advertised.

title: Room was great, staff was nice but didn't feel safe in lobby or elevators
text:
For the price, this hotel was a great find. It's in a good location a little out of the fray of the major touristy area, but still a lot of great restaurants nearby and easy access to the subway. The room was clean and well appointed (although the smoke alarm was hanging off the wall). The staff was friendly, but one of them didn't wear his mask over his nose and they were not good about asking guests to wear masks so we were in the *very small and very slow* elevator on 2 occasions with guests who were completely unmasked. I would have preferred to take stairs, but there were no stairs that were accessible to the lobby.  
I booked the room for 2 people, but we were only given 1 towel and 3 pillows. When I requested additional towels and a pillow on my way out to dinner, I was told they would put them in my room while I was out, but when I returned from dinner, they were not there. There is no way to quickly call the front desk from the room and I didn't want to take the elevator yet again to ask for them (and the police were on the first floor handling some sort of situation), so I waited until the morning and got them directly from one of the women who was cleaning the rooms. 
Overall the price was very right and the room was great, but I wasn't impressed with their COVID-19 rules in public places and the staff, although friendly, wasn't responsive.

title: Wonderful location at a reasonable price
text:
This place is only a couple blocks from Times Square and saying here made it a wonderful experience to do all the Times Square touristy stuff.

PROS: Location, Clean Room, Kitchenette

CONS: SLOWEST ELEVATOR EVER!!

title: Overall disappointing
text: I wish I could say much positive, but the only positive I could say is that the lady at front desk on 10/5 was fairly patient and the room is fairly quiet as I hoped. I can understand that due to COVID many hotels cancelled breakfast, but some still offers pre-packaged simplified breakfast while this hotel doesn't offer anything. Also, most hotels would store luggage but this hotel doesn't store luggage nor allow any early checkin, making it difficult to arrange my plan as I had to take my bag with me before I can check in 4pm. Also, I made some requests to have toothpastes, razors etc in Marriott App. There was nothing when I arrived at my room. It took me 3 phone calls and wait 2 hours to get some toothpastes and none of the other requested items like razor ever come. There wasn't an acknowledgement for marriott member at checkin (not that I care so much). The service is definitely lacking overall and not consistent with other Marriott branded hotels. The experience is mostly disappointing.

title: Worst hotel experience ever
text: A few weeks ago my husband and I  went to New York City city to celebrate my son‘s birthday. When we got back to our room Friday night the people next-door to us were playing loud rap music and talking loudly, yelling all night long. I attempted to call the front desk multiple times and never got an answer. My husband and I were up all night. The next day he went down and spoke to the front desk person who told him that they were many complaints about those people and that they had been spoken to. We were hopeful that Saturday night would be better. We got back to our room at midnight. The same people next-door were playing loud rap music and talking/yelling/laughing loudly.... so loudly that we had noise canceling headphones in and it still sounded like they were having a party in our room. We waited until about 1:30 am to call the front desk. They assured us they were sending security. I’m pretty sure that never happened as the noise level never changed it got worse. We called the front desk again at 2:30 and this time I believe they did send someone as I heard a knock at their door, but again the loud music and yelling went on. We finally got up at 3 am and decided to make our 6 hour drive back to Maine as it was evident we were not going to be able to sleep at all. We stayed at the hotel for two nights and were completely unable to get ANY sleep. The lack of concern shown by staff was disappointing.  Not to mention the fact that despite the no smoking signs posted throughout the hotel the entire place reeked.   When we got home I immediately emailed Marriot.  It took 5 days to get a response from the hotel and it was just a generic apology.  We don't typically complain much but did expect some type of compensation given the fact that we paid for a 2 night stay in a hotel and got zero sleep.  Not at all what we expected from a Marriot.

title: Nothing more than a roof on top of your head
text: Small room, noisy, most unacceptable is I asked for an extra bath towel since there is only one in the room and my fiancé and I were staying. Manager promised to send one but no one ever showed up. What else do you need to know? InterContiental is next door, treat yourself better next time.

title: Great!! and Reasonable
text:
I have no idea why  some people made bad review .. Oh well Just a luck!

This was our second time we've stayed within 2 months. The reason? Affordable. Location is great! . Not that we're interested on Times Square LOL
We are New Yorker so we know where to go LOL  
Just convenient to grab grocery at the store and heat up at our room kitchen .

This time on August 29 and 30th 2 nights  .. Apparently there are 2 side Like so called North tower or south tower :):)
We've gotta smaller kitchen compared to the last time   Last time the room was bit bigger so as the kitchen was bigger . So I kinda disappointed but it was great!
As woman I just rather to have bigger kitchen LOL No biggy

Room is clean Bathroom was clean big enough. Staff was good and friendly .

It was comfortable .

title: AWFUL NIGHTMARE STAY AWAY
text: I usually don't leave negative reviews, but it's my duty to do so in this case. If there was an option of leaving 0 stars, I would do so. This place is terrible! Someone smoked marihuana 24/7 on my floor.  I could even smell it in my room! I am not against marihuana in the least, but at a free-smoke hotel, this is unacceptable.  Also, I understand that due to COVID some things like breakfast and the gym are closed, but there has got to be a way of making up this inconvenience for the customer, but nothing was done.  As I was checking out, I asked if I could leave a small backpack while taking care of some things uptown. The answer was that due to COVID, they couldn't store anything.  Are they invoking COVID to simply cut off every amenity available to their clients? The customer service is awful. Do yourself a favor and get an Airbnb or stay elsewhere. Also, watch out for the predatory parking garage next to it, it is 55 dollars a night (a few blocks away there is another parking garage that only charges 25).

title: SCAM. Card charged double and housekeeping disaster
text:
I just noticed my card was CHARGED DOUBLE the amount when I booked and nothing has ever been cancelled or refunded after that. So I had to make an international call to check what happened. They said there was a glitch in the system and that they charged me for two nights by mistake when I booked for one night. Honestly, not sure how a Marriott hotel or any hotel for that matter, makes such a mistake. If I had not checked my card details, this would have slipped away.

The room was GROSS. There was a dead bug in the kitchenette, hair in the coffee brewer, the air filter system said filter had to be changed i.e, it's dirty, there were unknown marks (looked like dead bug marks) on the bathroom wall, and the nightstands were sticky with glass marks.

Absolutely DO NOT RECOMMEND and I definitely won't be back. 

They are clearly trying to recover profits by scamming guests by secretly charging double the amount and cutting housekeeping staff and serving guests dirty rooms.

I wonder if all the Marriott hotels in NYC are like this.

title: Housekeeping Issues
text:
We came for a short stay because the rates were great. The front desk at check in was quick and friendly and the location was great. Kitchen was well stocked with cookware and utensils (the microwave was unusually noisy but that’s a very minor issue.) There is also room service through Butler, which we have used before and think are great, so that was definitely a plus.

The huge issue we had was that there was pet hair everywhere in the room. It wasn’t something we noticed at first, but after dropping an item of black clothing on the rug, it was covered in pet hair when picked up. We then noticed  it more frequently, and even saw it on the nightstand phone. By the time we left after just two nights, we could see hair flying as we shook the blanket out. The biggest issue it raised for us was how well the room was cleaned prior to us arriving. Based on the amount of hair I don’t think it’s even possible that a vacuum was used on the carpet at all. Had we been very allergic to pets this would have been even worse 

Other minor issues was that we were two guests and there was only one set of towels in the room, but we were able to get a second set from housekeeping. Additionally, our refrigerator stopped working the afternoon before we were set to check out. Calls to the front desk went unanswered, luckily we didn’t have much in there to go bad but it did leave a small puddle of water on the floor. There was also a dishwasher in the room with no sign of detergent. 

All in all it was a good value for the location. We had thought about coming back and booking a room with a furnished patio but due to the issue with the pet hair, I don’t think we will be back.

title: Nightmare.
text:
I don’t usually leave reviews. Especially negative ones. This is not meant to bash the property but to warn others like us who might be considering a stay here in the present conditions. The world, and New York, are changed post COVID. We understand that. This property has beautiful rooms, with an equipped kitchen, were able to kindly check us in early, and the staff seem to genuinely want to help, however I think they are not equipped or trained to handle what is happening here.

My husband and I, in our mid 30s, were traveling from out of state due to me needing abdominal surgery at Sloan Kettering for a rare cancer, and had a week stay here (had never stayed at this specific property prior). We travel to NYC every 3-4 months for appointments, and typically pay $250-300 per night, and the price now including taxes was less than $100, surely because of decreased tourism and increased vacancy. We were surprised to see the hotel full, and wondered who would be traveling? Maybe medical providers?

The bad: marijuana smell pervasive through the areas we went in the hotel, and also in our room.  We don’t smoke, and the hotel claims to be smoke free. We stayed in the 6th floor. The smell was not only in the hallways, but in our room as well. We could see a haze when we opened the curtain and sunlight came in. Would usually start in the afternoon and into the night, but sometimes as early as 10 am. We had many conversations with the front desk, asking them to address it. They were certainly tired of us calling, we were also tired of having to call. They stated they couldn’t do much about it, they couldn’t accuse anyone of smoking. I asked if they could knock on doors, check for smell, etc. they agreed to call each room on the floor and remind them of no smoking. It actually did help that day, but started right back up the next day. The staff member told us that the fire alarm in the room should go off if they were smoking, unless they had been tampered with. Clearly likely multiple people were smoking, and the windows do open allowing for some of the smoke to go out, but the thought of rooms with kitchenettes having smoke detectors potentially disabled was disconcerting to say the least. We asked to change rooms, they said they could not as they were full. We then noticed the lobby smelled strongly as well as the first floor of marijuana. So strong. But not outside on the street. There is one HVAC unit for the hotel. 

There were also times of isolated shouting and yelling at night, but I had earplugs so that didn’t bother me as much. 

Then there were 2 parties on 2 separate nights lasting until about midnight, the worst with probably 15 or so teens or 20 somethings in one room, with loud music. I don’t know for sure, but the desk alluded that may have been broken up. 

There was also very loud music playing from several rooms on our floor during the daytime. 

Then on Saturday night the room next to us developed a shouting match between a male and female at 9 pm, and it shook me up terribly. Banging into the walls, screaming, crying. We called the front desk to report the situation and ask for security, they said they don’t have security. I asked if they could call 911, and they said they would send up the houseman to verify our report first before calling. We waited about 5 minutes, all the while the screaming continued, with more bumping and slamming sounds, and the woman said probably 100 times take your hand off me, leave me alone etc. I was genuinely afraid for her safety so we called 911 ourselves, and called to tell the front desk that. The situation continued while I prayed for a safe outcome and we waited for the police. The gentleman from the front desk called to tell me the houseman confirmed our report and the couple wouldn’t answer the phone or door, and they would be asked to leave after police arrived. Eventually around 930 police arrived and everything seemed to end peacefully. 

Now on Sunday, the marijuana smell ramped up again, and just before noon the fire alarm went off. 

Now, we move into the realm of conjecture. The gentleman at the front desk did tell us that their clientele has changed since the prices of the hotel dropped so significantly, resulting in new issues they have not had to deal with before. My guess is that many of their guests are using this as longer term housing due to the fact that there is a kitchenette in the room. At less than 100 per night including all fees the “rent” for a month at this hotel would be below average rent in manahattan, and also not include steps of background check, deposit, etc. required in a typical apartment situation. The issue comes in that I don’t think the staff here is capable of making the situation here any different. They seem to be understaffed, and frankly, I agree that they should not have to compromise their personal safety to uphold the usual standards of the hotel. But it is jarring to walk into this situation that feels like a flop house. 

What did we do? We had many conversations with several different front desk staff who genuinely cared and were trying to help, but were not able to bring about any resolution. We also asked for the manager’s information to reach out and see if they were able to help- we were given the front desk manager’s information rather than the GM (not sure if this was by design), and left a voicemail but were told she was off, so when we didn’t hear back from her we were not surprised, everyone is entitled to their time off. We were not given any other recourse after many complaints. Unable to switch rooms. 

Why didn’t we leave? Several reasons. I had just had a 4 hour abdominal surgery. It was difficult to even walk, I was not allowed to lift. We had had $125 of groceries, water bottles, etc. delivered on the first day by amazon. I was unable to help my husband with moving all this to a new hotel, and it wAs too much for him by himself. Also, we are not sure- it may be like this everywhere in the city right now! So we kept waiting it out. 

I know management typically responds to these reviews- I don’t want a response! We reached out many times. I don’t want an apology, or a refund, or a credit, nothing. I understand times are hard and maybe they are just doing what they need to in order to stay viable. I just want to warn people- I wish someone had written a review to warn me. I also think they should hire security to assist their staff.

I understand that these things do not bother everyone- is so the hotel may be a good fit. Would definitely not recommend for families with young children or older people.

All I wanted was relative quiet and for non smoking rules to be enforced, but alas.

title: Disappointed
text:
Arrived at 4:10 to check in and my room wasn’t ready .. disappointing considering check in was at 3:00.  I waited  30 minutes until my room available... 
the next morning I was awaken at 1am to the sound of what I thought was my shower,  but after further investigation, there was water leaking out of the light in my shower from the room above me .  I called the front desk then the next morning showed them a video... they didn’t seem too worried.  I was told it was probably from the guest above me showering??  That’s safe huh?

To top that off, my credit card I only used at the hotel for them to swipe for incidentals was compromised.  I had to cancel it and am now waiting on a new one.   

Besides all that, my room was clean, no complaints there.

title: Small, but comfy!!
text: We stayed in New York before, but the first time in Time Square.  The hotel is perfectly located, despite the COVID-19 period.  We felt safe, the reception desk staff was friendly and helpful.  No breakfast was served, maybe they could have indicated this beforehand.  Will recommend this hotel if you want to be central.  Unfortunately restaurants and shops were closed, but could be an awesome stay.

title: Cancellation due to Corona
text:
Excellent service provided by Maria & Ariel at the front desk! When I called to ask if it’s possible to cancel my booking they were
super friendly and helped me out in this situation. Would totally recommend !

title: Tolles Personal, Tolle Lage!
text:
Wir waren hier um unseren Urlaub zu verbringen. 
Das Hotel war absolut fantastisch, es war sehr sauber, die Lage ist perfekt, das Personal war unglaublich nett, ein besonderes Danke möchten wir an Marie Lowe, Ariel Enriquez und Wilfredo Morales aussprechen, sie standen uns bei Rat und Tat zur Seite.

title: Perfect stay
text: We stayed for two nights after a 19 day cruise. To rest before flight back home to California and to see a broadway show. This is a great small hotel in a perfect location a few blocks from Times Square and near all the broadway shows.  Rooms are small but very comfortable and new. Bed was comfortable and the tiny kitchen was a bonus with refrigerator, microwave and kitchen items like silverware, pots and pans, etc. Very easy check-in and staff was friendly and accommodating. Breakfast in the morning was pretty good with lots of variety. Hot items are an egg dish (not made on site probably reheated omelette) sausage and self made waffles. It was enough to start the day without having to buy anything until lunch. I’d stay here again. Better than the big expensive hotels.

title: A hotel with hospitality in the heart of NY
text: What a wonderful stay we had at the Towneplace Suites. The moment we arrived, Wilfredo made us feel so welcome with a big hello and smile.  We felt so comfortable like home sweet home in your hotel. What a great location by Times Square, the Broadway Shows and fabulous restaurants. We could walk anywhere or get right on a train. The inclusive breakfast area was clean and spacious always filled with items with an array of foods served until 10:30am! Water was available in the lobby 24/7. Rooms were clean and fresh with kitchen area and space utilized well for Manhattan.Thank you especially to Wilfredo & Cris at the front desk, what amazing guest representatives, outstanding and warm customer service, personality, professionalism, knowledge about the hotel and area you both had. Appreciate Ariel & Marie too! Everyone went & everything was above & beyond during our stay! Great valve, attentive staff and some special moments that we will never forget!

title: Great staff!
text: Upon checking in, there was a technical issue with the electronic key maker. The staff was very courteous and did everything they could to make check-in easier. (also, there's hot chocolate in the lobby :))

title: Прекрасно
text:
Локация – лучшая. 
Завтрак стандартный для Америки. Омлет, да вафли. Но всё вкусно. 
Номера небольшие, уютные и с кухней. 
Кофе / чай всегда бесплатно. 

Лучше брать окна во двор, иначе шумно с улицы. 

Да свои $ – один из лучших вариантов.

title: Better than we expected!
text:
Me and my partner stayed here after seeing a great price on booking.com so we changed our reservation to here and we didn’t regret it! We got a lot more than we expected. 

Check in was great, very quick and front desk staff were very helpful. 

Only one lift which was small and could be quite slow but did not bother us as we just used the stairs too. 

Room was fab! Very clean and quiet, bed was on the small side but very comfortable and the pillows were fantastic. 

Breakfast for free was a shock, we got a little plate to start our day and if we wanted breakfast out or was in a rush the hot drinks were great to take on the go. 

Hot drinks were there all day to be had so we made them when we was popping in and out so that saves a few $ also. 

Was better than we thought and if we return to NY we will stay again.

title: Great Hotel In Times Square!
text: I visit the city at least a couple times a year and have stayed in many hotels in the city. I highly recommend this hotel. It had everything we wanted, Breakfast, Refridgerator, Coffee Maker, and being right in Times Square. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were quiet. I heard very little of the honking cars outside. I was pleasantly surprised by how affordable the room was, especially with its prime location.

title: Great staff, great location!
text: VERY helpful staff. They checked us in quickly and made a room available as soon as possible (early). The location was fantastic! Just steps from the metro lines and close to many parking options (no onsite parking). The breakfast was great too.

title: Awesome Hotel, convenient to everything NYC
text: We just left the TownePlace suites and had an amazing experience. First off, the location is excellent and accommodating to everything you’d want to do while visiting NYC. It’s two blocks from Times Square, the port authority terminal, and tons of great food on restaurant row. Secondly, the staff was incredibly friendly, recommending great restaurants/things to do. In addition, the hotel was clean and had everything you could possibly want (including a nice continental breakfast and iced water/coffee at all times in the lobby.) The rooms are fully stocked with coffee maker, refrigerator, iron, microwave, etc. Despite our room facing the street it was even quiet in the evenings. We had a great stay and I would HIGHLY recommend TownePlace Times Square NYC to others.

title: Perfect spot
text:
We came up for the Billy Joel concert and decided to stay over and I chose this hotel since it was a Marriott.  I was not disappointed at all. Everything was exceptional.
So close to everything in the Time Square area. Easy walking distance to show, resturants, etc.   I highly recommend the hotel

title: Lo justo
text:
La habitación pequeña. Nueva espacio muy justo. Poco lugar para guarda valijas y ropa. Microondas, heladerita y hornallas ellectricas todo nuevo.
Baño nuevo y muy bien, justo.
El desayuno que estaba incluido era un poco pobre lo malo fue que no reponian rapido ni nada parecido, se acababan las diversas cosas ya que el hotel estaba lleno.
Pero en general la atención amable y el hotel muy nuevo y limpio.

title: New Year's Eve @ NYC
text: I spent New Year's Eve here and had a great day. I did go to the ball drop. For those who are going to the ball drop just note that this hotel does not clear the security gates to Times Square. I was hoping it did but it didn't. Nevertheless it is super close to Times Square. And the staff was great. For New Year's Eve it wasn't too crazy being that it's a quaint Hotel. I never had to wait too much for the elevator and the staff for the nicest staff I met in New York on this trip. I stayed in three different hotels during my stay in New York on this trip this one had the best customer service and newest rooms. I stayed on the 5th floor and had a perfect view of the Port Authority Bus Terminal. I Had A Accessible room but I believe it was more roomy because of it. Breakfast was okay I wish they have pork sausage.

title: Pour la situation
text:
Très bon hôtel, idéalement situé (à 1 rue de Times square) Personnel accueillant, aimable. Chambre propre, bien équipé, literie confortable. Point noir concernant le petit déjeuner pour nous français : choix quasi inexistant au bout du 2ème petit déjeuner nous étions déjà à saturation : en sucré uniquement des yaourts et pancake et en salé (quand il y en a ..) quelques saucisses, œuf, cheddar et baggel mais il faut avoir de la chance pour en avoir ... pas assez de place dans la salle pour permettre à tout le monde de s’assoir même en période creuse ! 
En bref hôtel confortable, propre, avec un personnel agréable mais à recommander surtout pour l’emplacement !

title: Great Location, Great Service
text:
Location is very convenient to Time Sqaure and Midtown. We booked this hotel since we were returning our rental car while in the citry. This hotel is on the same block as hertz/National and perfect for convenience. The staff exceeded our expectation of service, especially Marie and Ariel- THANK YOU!
The rooms are smaller than other TownePlace properties but that that should be expected when staying in NYC. The facility is clean and wll kept.

title: Good Location and Staff
text: Located right in the heart of theater district.  Also walking distance to Times Square and other Manhattan attractions.  We had a 5pm flight so Ariel and Chris were able to help with a late checkout so we didn't have to drag our bags around on our last day.  They also help print boarding passed since Spirit doesn't have boarding passes on their application.  Wasn't thrilled getting an accessible room but I guess I could have made more of a stink about it since we are both Elite members with Marriott.

title: Very bad
text: We booked our rooms in august. We called over 2 times and tried to check in early. They never told us they were over booked until we arrived at night. Very poor management. Would not recommend and not good customer service.

title: Muy Recomendable
text:
Muy buen hotel, muy buena la limpieza, el desayuno está bien, el ascensor es rápido, la habitación medio chica pero muy completa y lo mejor de todo es la ubicación, para quienes visitan por primera vez NYC como nosotros es un lugar para parar.
Las chicas de la recepción muy predispuestas y te hablan en castellano. Marie, Crystal y ariel

title: Great Location-Very Accomodating
text: Hotel was just as depicted. Nice rooms, great location near Time Square / Theatre District. Hotel Desk Guest Services Rep was Phenomenal.  The rooms were clean, beds comfortable and great price of the modern facility and location. Parking next door was self-park, but plenty of spaces and reasonable for NYC @ $52/night. Hotel room was well equipped, clean, and beds comfortable. Hotel is situated close to many restaurants, Time Square and a short few blocks walk to many Broadway Theatres.  We were heading into the city for an afternoon matinee on Broadway and a 2nd show later that night. Was going to be getting in early @ 11:00 a.m. to do some sightseeing and grab lunch. Contacted the Hotel Desk on the way, spoke to Marie Lowe (Guest Services Rep) hoping to be able to get checked in early. , and she was very accommodating and was able to get us in 3 hours before check-in so we could freshen up for the 2:00 matinee. She also took the time to recommend a restaurant in the immediate area for lunch so we could be close when the room was done. We were in room at 1:00. Great Service and Marie is a fine rep of the Hotel, great employee, always smiling and personable.  I would highly recommend this hotel for reasonable hotel in NYC Time Square & Theatre District area. I would definitely come back.

title: A Very Pleasant Stay
text: The room was clean and modern. The front desk staff (especially Marie & Cris) were very friendly -- top notch and greatly appreciated. The hotel is a close walk to theaters and restaurants. We had such a pleasant stay at this hotel. I would definitely visit again.

title: Great location
text: Friendly, professional and excellent staff. Room very neat and has everything could need. Being in the city that never sleeps it is not to noisey. Short easy walk from Port Authority bus station. Adequate breakfast, lift can be slow at times but there is warning about that. Sad to leave and would comeback again next time am in NYC. Thank you Cris and Marie for your excellent service

title: Great location!
text: Great location to the theatre district and Times Square.  Nice clean hotel and a decent breakfast included.  All the front desk staff were very helpful, friendly, and accommodating.  Can’t wait to cone back and stay again.

title: The best staffs at Towne Place Suites
text: The location of this hotel is only a few blocks away from Time Square.  The front desks staffs (Marie and others) went out of their way to make my family feel special.  They found the crib for our 11-month old baby.  Great staffs are what make the experience so special.  On behalf of my family, thank you very much!

title: Bed bug infested
text: As a 30 yr.  Bonvoy Gold/Silver member this is the first time I have encountered bed bugs at a Marriott property.  I found bugs in my bed in Rm. 609, killed a few and took pictures.  I summoned the Head of Housekeeping to my room and she apologized,and said "she had not personally inspected this room prior ro my visit".  I accepted relocation to the 4th floor and after surveying the room I killed and photographed 3 adult bugs in room 402.  I met with the hotel day Mgr. and tried to get him to move me to another Marriott, but he did not.  I was assigned room 202, which appeared bug free for my 2 nd night.  I was astonished that my stay was not comped, Mgr. refused to comp both nights, just refunded one.  I have appealed to Marriott Corp and case is pending.  I had to bag and freeze all my luggage for 24 hrs, then launder and dry clean before bring anything into my home...

title: Small Room But Everything Was Nice
text: The room was small but the location large. Service was excellent and the location lacked for nothing. It would have been nice if they partnered with a parking location for a discounted rate, but we are out of towners. The lobby was nice and while the free breakfast was standard for the industry the coffee was quite good. No complaints. I'll stay again for short visits to the theatre district.

title: Convenient location near theaters & restaurants
text:
This hotel offers a kitchenette en suite and clean, modern bedroom & bathroom.  There is a good breakfast in the lobby as an amenity.  The staff is friendly.  The location is close to the theater district and to Restaurant Row and other good dining options.  Bus,
subway, and taxis are nearby.  My wife and I were happy with our 5 day stay.
What could improve?  There are only 2 small hooks in the bathroom for clothes and no towel rack. No toilet paper dispenser;  do it yourself.  A desk & chair would be better than the small sofa crammed into a corner.  But the room price was fine and we would return.

title: Disappointing Stay
text: This is NYC, so was expecting small, but it is a stretch to call this a suite. Kitchenette would have been nice if we were cooking, but a 3'x2' slab isn't a couch. Worst part was the door latch sound that happened 2/3 times a minute all day and all night and the paper thin walls. Staff thought that the sound might be the elevator, but didn't really seem to care. Talked to other guests from the 7th floor and they had the same noise issues. The single elevator is extremely slow.  Free breakfast is a bonus in NYC and does save you some dollars.

title: Nice
text:
Clean, modern rooms walking distance to Manhattan Cruise Terminal and all the Times Square restaurants and theaters. Rooms area bit small but the price for that location more then makes up for the size.  

Staff is lovely and there’s a nice complimentary breakfast served daily.

title: One elevator
text: We just returned from an 8 night stay.  It does have a good location- very close to Times Square.  We had a king sized bed- room was small, but the main problem was one elevator for all- housekeeping and maintenance and guests- and very slow, too.  Who builds a hotel with one elevator!!  Breakfast was ok, except many of the guests use it as a meeting place and take up all the seats just to wait on others.  There is no seating in the tiny lobby.  When we checked in, we inquired about using a cab or an Uber and were told they had a cab service they used and it would be no problem arranging a cab for us.  The next morning, we inquired about a cab and were told that was only for service to JFK, and that we could go out and walk a few streets and hail a taxi.  What!!  So if you want any concierge service, this isn’t the hotel for you- it reminds me of a Super 8. Once during the week, there was a newspaper for guests, and once during the week we got a washcloth.  We never got to use the safe in the lobby as it was always full.

title: Suficiente
text:
Buen hotel, muy nuevo, habitación pequeña pero bien. No hay casi lugar para valijas y ropa. El baño muy bien: ducha, inodoro y pileta. Ok
Desayuno muy pobre, no reponen rápido ni nada que se le parezca. Nunca hay jamón, y muchos faltantes. Poco espacio. Bien ubicado.

title: A fantastic hotel perfectly located for the visitor to NYC.
text: We arrived at the TownPlace Suites after an 18-hour flight from Singapore and a crazy ride in a taxi from Newark Airport in rush hour. We were met by Chris and Marie, without doubt the two most cheerful and helpful reception staff we have ever encountered in 30 years of travelling. They really looked after us and helped make our stay  memorable, as did the rest of the staff. The hotel itself is perfectly placed near Times Square and close to the Subway. We found it the perfect base for our excursions around the city. Our room was excellent with a very comfortable king-size bed and a big bathroom with walk-in shower. Breakfast is great with good variety and quality. We were very impressed with the TownPlace Suites and would definitely stay there again.

title: New find
text: Here on Business, so not a great location for me, but very much the ideal spot for tourists.  What makes this Hotel stand out is the Staff, always smiling,always helpful and very caring.  Their best kept secret is that there are a few rooms with a Patio, which can make for a relaxing area after a busy day, what makes it even more special it is quiet, away from the noise and bustle of the streets.  Special mention to the Reception staff and Marie in particular who has been very helpful.

title: Average service in a good location
text:
This place is relatively new and this might show through some “teething problems” which prevent me from giving a higher rating. Easily fixed ... but someone needs to step up and do it! 

The location is good and price can be very reasonable for NYC. Walking distance to Times Square, with a radius of a block in any direction you have everything you could want - bars, restaurants, fast food, shops, banks etc. Subway Station on the corner gives access to Port Authority buses and trains, and links to Times Square Station underground. Easy to get anywhere in the city from here. 

The reality is this is a budget hotel. A step up from an Ibis or Econolodge but a big step down from a regular Marriott. Don’t expect too much ... you won’t be disappointed ... but be realistic and don’t ever pay full price! 

I should also say at this point I am thankful to Ariel for fixing an issue with our booking. The credit card used for guarantee when booked 8 months ago expired last month ... picked up the day before we arrived and we were given the chance to use a different card to get sorted. Thanks Ariel for your help. 

The rooms were small - but functional enough for three of us. Queen bed and single sofa bed in the room. Sofa Bed was not made up on arrival - even though they knew three of us were coming. Kitchenette has all you need as well. Bathroom was clean and functional. Coffee maker in room and ice machine on ground floor. There is no in room safe available at all. 

The two disappointments which drop this from a 5 circle rating to a 3 ... breakfast and housekeeping! 

On three occasions out of 5 nights our room was not made up before 4pm. Makes it hard to come home from a day out and shower before going to a show if no fresh towels etc! They also point out that unless staying more than 7 days, this service is a “refresh” - so things like beds are made but sheets not changed. However, the coffee filters were never checked and replaced - not the sugar, creamers etc. No general cleaning of bathrooms or floors done - just make the bed, swap towels and toiletries by the looks of things. On two occasions, we were in our room in the afternoon and someone from housekeeping simply scanned their card and walked in - without knocking or announcing themselves! Sure ... we could have put the do not disturb sign on the  door - except we needed to be disturbed to get room serviced ... just not so rudely! Simple solutions perhaps - have a sign to put on the door saying “please make up my room” (rather than simply do not knock or pet napping versions!); get housekeeping more consistent and timely ... and knock before entering any room! They are small fixes in the big scheme of things! 

The second lost dot is for breakfast. We experienced the good and the bad. There are not even close to enough sitting spaces for the guests. Maybe remove the tv cabinet and add in four more chairs? Reconsider the use of the big lounges and see if something smaller would work to allow more tables and chairs. There are no options one full - other than return to your room and eat in your bed! 

On some days, there was a lady on duty who constantly cleaned tables, re-stocked supplies and ensured everything went well. These days were a pleasure and that lady is to be commended. On her days off, no-one did this until I had to go and ask them to! This was met with grunts and a general grumpiness ... but is it really too much to ask someone on staff to open the cupboard below and refill the pastries when they run out? Or top up the fruit ... or make fresh coffee as needed. 

Simple solution here too ... every morning we watched two or three staff members come in and help themselves to some breakfast. I have no issue with this ... good on the hotel for supporting their workers. I do have an issue when a guy takes the last beagle for himself back to reception but makes no effort to top supplies up for paying guests. When a staff member gets their food, make a rule that they check everything and top up as needed as part of this process. It’s a very easy thing to do .. and would make a huge difference. 

I guess to sum up our experience, it gets back to first impressions last. We arrived at 8pm after almost 30 hours of travel with two flight delays. We stood outside the front doors with a back and carry-on each trying to open the doors manually whilst two guys chatted behind the reception desk. It was not until we had almost finished opening the second door that one of them made an effort to show us where the automatic door button was! We didn’t expect a full bellboy service, but seeing three people struggle with luggage and taking your time to assist in showing the trick to the doors set the tone for the stay ... so much potential ... but just comes up short each time! 

We would stay again ... but would warn others not to expect perfection just because you pay a high price ... it is NYC cheap ... but has it limitations too!

title: You Should Stay Here
text: We stayed a week at this hotel. It was lovely and clean. The staff was absolutely professional and courteous. We felt they were genuinely happy to see us each time we arrived back from a busy day. I would highly recommend it.

title: Great for business travelers
text: I have spent four nights at this great hotel. It’s a small hotel minutes from Times Square. Each room has a kitchenette which is perfect if you don’t wish to eat at restaurants. Breakfast is free with a variety of food. The room is very convenient for a business traveler. It only misses a desk and a chair, yet the lobby has a space if you wish to work on some files. They offer free coffee, tea and hot chocolate all day long. Front desk staff are very helpful specially the front desk manager, I lost my holy book at the hotel and the manager called to see if I am missing it. How brilliant!!! Thank you for a memorable stay.

title: A hidden gem in the middle of Times Square.
text:
I'm almost hesitant to write this review because the cat will be out of the bag on this great property. 

I cashed in Bonvoy points for my family to spend 3 nights here this past week. I'm a frequent Marriott traveler and love that they have properties like this that are good for families, especially in NYC. 

The location just cannot be beat- this saved us so much money in transportation costs as we were right in the middle of everything. Even with a young child, I felt totally comfortable walking from the hotel to/from many activities, day and night. 

The rooms- okay, it's NYC. The rooms here are small. We were expecting that and it wasn't a huge deal. Three of us fit into a standard room (1 queen & 1 pullout sofa) relatively fine. It did require some side-stepping when using the bathroom in the middle of the night but it was workable given that we weren't in the room very much. 

Everything was CLEAN and housekeeping made sure we had everything we needed. The kitchenette was a nice touch and made it easier to store leftovers. 

They contract with a company to provide room service, which was surprisingly good and VERY surprisingly affordable. Charged right to the room and fast delivery. 

Breakfast was great. It's more or less your standard hotel-issue breakfast, but to be available every day with hours that extend into late morning was a big bonus for our trip. In NYC, that's probably a $50/day savings for our family of 3. Hot water seemed to run out frequently and on busy days another waffle machine would be nice, but overall very pleased. 

Water is available all day long so we were able to keep our refillable bottles topped off. 

We were in the South tower and overall enjoyed it as there weren't many rooms on each floor so waiting for the (single) elevator) wasn't too bad. When it was bad, it was easy enough to take the stairs in this relatively short (for NYC) property. 

But I need to recognize the staff- they are AWESOME. Our son got sick in the middle of the night on our first night, and the front desk staff was quick to send up new sheets/towels/bedding and take the old stuff away so that we could all get back to sleep. It was an adventure in an already tiny room but the team made it a lot less of a problem to have to deal with. 

I would have no hesitation in staying here again. It made our quick trip very enjoyable and allowed us to do a lot without spending a ton. Thank you and we will be back!

title: Muy buena elección
text: Hotel muy bien situado (muy cerca de Times Square y del metro). Habitación triple un poco pequeña pero hemos dormido muy bien. Un plus el tener cocina y lavaplatos en la habitación. El personal muy agradable y servicial. Si volvemos a visitar NY intentaremos repetir hotel.

title: Consigliato
text: È un hotel nuovo e piccolo. Personale cordiale. Le camere sono un po piccole ma hanno l angolo cottura molto funzionale. La colazione non eccezionale ma cmq buona. Posizione centrale a pochi passi da Times Square. Vicino a fermata metro linea A E C.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: The staff at the hotel  were friendly and helpful from check in til checkout. I would like to mention "Aminata" she  was very helpful in helping us plan our day. Aminata provided us with printed directions  including  which trains to catch,museums and other sites to see along the way. This hotel is in  great location ! It is  nestled on a quiet  side street that is less than a 1 min walk to 8th ave  where all the hustle and bustle of New York City is happening. It is located a  block or 2 from time square. The  subway,resturaunts and entertainment are within walking distance.  The hotel lobby was clean ,they offer  complementary coffee and water all day.  The room was perfectly compacted to meet all your needs including a kitchenette with dishes, stove,microwave,coffee pot and refrigerator.

title: Great location, terrific service, excellent amenities
text: I’m not sure I’d want to do an extended stay in such a small room, but otherwise, for a weekend in New York City, this is a find! Though small, the room is comfortable, with a working kitchenette including pots, pans, utensils, coffee, tea and condiments. The bathroom also is small, but has a marvelous stall shower. Wifi is free and reasonably fast, depending on the hour. Free breakfast includes hot and cold food choices, fruit, coffees, teas and breads, rolls, bagels, muffins and cereal. Quite a spread. The staff is absolutely outstanding: friendly, cheerful, helpful (often without being asked). The price is slightly below average for such a good location near Times Square. Highly recommend this place (in fact we just had a friend commit to a 4-day stay based on our enthusiasm during a phone call).

title: Surprisingly Spacious New Hotel
text: The rooms was much more spacious than I expected. The kitchen area was well stocked and immaculate. The bathroom was well lit and also very clean. Room was surprisingly quiet, considering it's location. Fast WIFI and quiet and effective AC. All the employees at the hotel that I encountered were friendly and helpful

title: Independence Day Getaway
text:
We decided to stay here for one night after returning from the Hamptons.  The location was very convenient to restaurants and theaters.  We were able to walk to dinner, Times Square and our Broadway play.  However, the rooms were too small and the bathroom was tiny.  The hallways were also narrow and the elevators were slow.  

We will likely choose another property that has a convenient location but with bigger rooms and bathrooms.

title: This Is Why I Am Loyal to Marriott
text:
I contacted the TownePlace Suites via the Bonvoy App to ask a few questions because our arrival.  Marie was so patient and helpful with all of my questions (I had several).

When Delta canceled my flight the night before we were suppose to arrive, I sent Marie another message and told her about the situation.  She helped me so much by telling me not to worry that they would take care of me.  They wouldn't charge me for the room if I wasn't able to arrive but they would have one for me if I was able to arrive in time.  There was so much in the air and Marie just helped me so much with my stress level because it was one less thing I had to worry about.

Upon my arrival to the hotel, Michael provided me all the necessary information (even though it was 1:30 a.m. and I just wanted to go to sleep).  He was friendly and knew about my conversation with Marie.  He was kept up to speed about my situation and welcome my daughter and I to the hotel.

The next morning we were able to meet Marie in person and she was so friendly and down to earth.  She checked my reservation to make sure everything was correct.  I had some problems with my initial room and she quickly offered to have me change rooms.  She gave me plenty of time to switch and made sure my stay was comfortable and I was happy with everything.

My daughter and I then enjoyed breakfast and met Aminata who was also amazing.  She was so friendly, started brief conversations with us, assisted us when we needed something, etc.  She was so great and was such a friendly spirit to start our mornings off with.

We stayed a week and I would definitely consider returning to this hotel just to see these friendly faces again.

Also, the hotel is so close to Time Square - it's within walking distance.  The subway entrance is only 400 ft away and extremely convenient.  There are grocery stores (Whole Foods, Food Emporium), great restaurants, and dessert places nearby.  If you're going to see Frozen, the theater is on the same street!  Aladdin in just a couple streets over.  We're in the Theater District so it couldn't get any better and more convenient.

One thing - the rooms are TINY!  I went only with my daughter and we barely had enough space.  There isn't much closet space and no where to store your luggage.  The fridge is a mini fridge but it was sufficient.  Counter space is limited.  Ask for a room that isn't a corner room.  I think there may be larger rooms on the ground level (C1 or C2).

Thank you, TownePlace Suites for such an amazing stay!!

title: Great location, clean hotel, fun rooftop
text: Perfect location for anything you would want to do in the city. Within minutes walking distance to Broadway shows, within minute walk to subway station 42nd st subway station. The rooftop just opened up and has a nice lounge area with 2 grills you can cook on! Just ask the front desk for utensils to use. The doors were also open to walk along the roof to other locations other than the hang out area. We had a nice night-cap overlooking the city while the blackout happened last weekend. Breakfast was average complimentary hotel breakfast, but had great coffee! Would definitely stay here again

title: Excellent location !
text:
Close enough to Times Square and theatres, just far enough away from the noise and hustle.  Stayed here for 3 nights and were very happy with our stay, The hotel is fairly new (opened this year I believe) and although the reception area isn't very inspiring, the hotel is nicely furnished and decorated. Our "suite" was below ground level at the front, but had it's own little open air courtyard at the back. The room itself was comfortable with a very well equipped kitchen, good TV and wifi, and excellent air conditioning.  There's a lounge/breakfast room at the front of the hotel where a free budget breakfast is provided, with a changing menu every day. This hotel also has a roof terrace which sadly, was closed for maintenance while we were there.
The reception staff were without exception, friendly and helpful. The only criticism I have of this hotel is that there is only one (very slow) elevator, and often we would just walk down the stairs rather than having to wait. That aside, for a short stay in the centre of NYC, this is a great choice and I would happily stay here again.

title: Prime location; and a just lovely staff
text: From the moment that I walked in and was greeted warmly by Yelissa; and subsequently helped by Marie--the stay could not have been more positive.  They were most gracious in working with me with my early arrival.  This hotel is located conveniently in the theatre district; this is why I chose it.  It was very easy for me to walk everywhere.  I was there specifically to see shows; fine dining and visit.  This is why people select the Times Square sea; For breakfast, I trotted up to my most favorite bagel store on 51st and third; but, enjoyed the TownePlace coffee and their flavored creamers.  Every member of the support staff was kind and friendly; and I am only sorry that I did not ask everyones name as I moved throughout the hotel to give further recognition.  My suite was clean; had everything I needed.  This will be my new go to hotel when in NYC.

title: Super hotel with a couple of serious service flaws
text: We stayed at this hotel for one night while in NYC to attend a Broadway show. The front-desk personnel were superb, the public spaces and sleeping rooms were modern and spotless, and we slept wonderfully well on the comfortable beds. Unfortunately, two issues marred what otherwise would have been a first-rate stay. The first is that the hotel's wifi never worked, even in the public spaces, The second is that, 45 minutes into the breakfast period, the egg dish, some of the breads, and the coffee had already run out. Eventually they were replenished, but there was no coffee for nearly 30 minutes and no eggs for at least an hour -- and this despite our notifying the front desk. It was the most poorly maintained breakfast area of any such hotel my husband (who travels for a living) and I had ever encountered. If the hotel corrects these details, then I'd recommend this property wholeheartedly. Great location.

title: Poor breakfast
text:
Had slightly mixed feelings about this place. It's ok if you want somewhere really central and close to Times Square - which means it's busy and noisy - but the space and lifts are inadequate and breakfast really poor.
My room was ok, with quite a lot packed in such as a coffeemaker, fridge, iron and board, but no safe which to my mind is an essential requirement. I asked at reception to use their safety deposit boxes but they were all in use! My room was at the front, so it was quite noisy at night with traffic and other street noise. But the room was comfortable with a tiny sofa and a firm mattress on the bed. The bathroom was compact and very clean.
But limited space in the hotel meant a very limited breakfast selection and insufficient seating. Nothing gluten-free was on offer, so I had to make do with some pretty strange pre-cooked meat and egg items and tea.
The lift always took forever to come and was obviously inadequate for the size of the hotel.
The promised same-day laundry service actually took 24 hours longer than promised and was the most expensive I have ever used anywhere in the world.

title: Great location
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 11 nights in May- June. 
I was not impressed with the hotel. Breakfast was terrible! Plastic plates, fork and knives, no fruit at all. Not much to choose food to choose from. 
There was no safe at the room witch I think is important. 
The cleaning of the room was not hygienic at all. For 11 nights my bedclothes was not changed once. The bathroom was dirty and the shower terrible! 
Most of the staff was was polite and helpful, but some of the people working in the reception didn't even greet when I meant them. 
When I visited the rooftop was not ready and I wasn’t allowed to go up there. 
The only thing great about this hotel was the location. 
I will not be staying here next time I visit.

title: Mostly Good
text:
The hotel is virtually brand new and the location is excellent.  There's a subway entrance just down the street, and Times Square and numerous broadway theaters are within easy walking distance.  All of the hotel staff that we encountered were extremely nice and helpful.  The breakfast options were good, but the breakfast area is relatively small and seating is limited.  The bed in our room was comfortable and the bathroom and shower are very nice, although the shower is a bit cramped.  I didn't care for the room layout, though, which made the room seem even smaller than it already is.  We had a 1 king studio suite, which is basically just a narrow hallway that ends in a bedroom that has a cramped feel to it.  The kitchen area runs along the side of the hallway, which is really only wide enough for one person to pass through at a time.  There's no desk other than a small nightstand and small circular table in the corner of the bedroom, so there's no good place to set up a laptop if you're a techno-dinosaur like me.  I ended up using the ironing board as a laptop desk while sitting on the side of the bed.

That said, I'd still rate the overall value of the room as very good considering the location, cleanliness and convenience of a kitchen area with dishes & utensils.  We would certainly consider staying again if we ever return to NYC.

title: Good Room, Great Location
text: Towneplace Suites is in a great location, just off 8th Ave in the theater district.  The room is small with an enormous kitchen (why?) but it is new, stylish, clean and comfortable with a good bathroom and walk in shower.  The hotel is close to theater district restaurants as well as the abundance of restaurants in Hell's Kitchen on 9th Ave.  They have a generous complimentary breakfast .It is also near multiple transportation options.

title: Excellent experience!
text: Absolutely loved our stay here. Our room was spacious (not much of a view though) had a mini kitchen complete with refrigerator, stove top, coffee pot, plates and cooking utensils. Included a smart TV that had hulu and Netflix access. Large heavy shade that went down for total darkness. The bathroom was large with a fabulous shower. Maria at the front desk was friendly and extremely helpful with everything that we needed. There is a continental breakfast included with the stay. Coffee, tea, a selection of cold juices, cereal, bagels, fruit, waffles, eggs and more. There is limited seating to enjoy it but we just took it back to our room. Location is close to everything you could possibly want. We were able to walk to central park and times square. Subway is close to take you to the rest of the city. There are a lot of restaurants, pharmacies, liquor stores and gift shops also in walking distance. Highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again!

title: Fantastic Stay
text: We were in NYC to see family and see a show.  Incredibly friendly staff, room wasn’t ready when we arrived but we were very early.  We checked bags and went about our day.  Got a call when our room was ready.  Ready very early.  Adequate breakfast.  New room and very quiet.  Fabulously located near shows and Central Park.  And last but not least, an incredible price.  Would love to come back in the future!

title: Great location
text: This hotel only opened in November 2018 and is so well situated 2 blocks from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Friendly staff , Comfortable clean room with kitchenette, smallish bed I would say maybe a queen at most. Fab breakfast provided basic but it’s all you need to start your day. Turn right out of the hotel and there is a subway station on the street corner, which has access to most lines. A great New York pizza place ,shake shack, an Irish pub all in the way to Times Square . Turn left out of the hotel ,2 Nice coffee shops and then fantastic Italian restaurants , so you don’t need to venture far for food. There is also a fantastic laundry drop off service on the street opposite the hotel which we utilised with same day pick up !! Extremely handy for those travelling on to other spots.

title: Not awful (for a NYC hotel)
text: Small rooms and ridiculously slow elevator (just the one elevator!) but that's typical for NYC hotels. Lots of little problems...room not ready after check in time, noisy employees in the hallways, housekeeping knocking on doors when they shouldn't be. If you get a room on the C level (one level below reception) you will constantly be hearing employees talking and doors opening and slamming EVERY.THIRTY.SECONDS. I had an upgrade and it included an unusable patio (no furniture, no view)...??? But, in NYC it is hard to get a hotel that has it all unless you want to spend $400 a night or more. Front desk staff very friendly I will say that. Also location is great!

title: A comfortable week
text:
I recently stayed here with my wife for a week. We were visiting NYC for the first time from the UK and got a good deal on the room rate for this hotel. 

It is in a great location. Close to times square. There is also an entrance to the subway only 30 seconds walk away. There are plenty of good restaurants close by. Mama Mia is worth a look and so is bare burger. 

We had a room in the main building which faced the road. We were on the 6th floor and we could hear the road noise. This could be a problem if you are not use to noise. Drivers in NY like to use their horn at all times of the day and night for very little reason so this can wake you up. There is also a fridge in the room which makes some noise. 
None of this bothered us after the first night. With all the places we went and things we did we were so tired at the end of the days we slept well. Also make use of the stairs. Its easy for going down to the lobby and as there is only one lift it is often quicker to walk down the stairs than wait for the lift. 

The breakfast is decent. It is best to get down there earlier. A couple of times we went down about 8.30 and it was busy but we still managed to get a seat. 
The only downside really is the fact is that all the stuff used for breakfast is disposable. Not obvious if they recycle anything. That could do with being looked at! 

The breakfast items were kept stocked up so never had an issue getting anything. 

All the staff were very helpful and could answer any of our questions. 

I would happily return to this hotel in the future.

title: Waited but worth it
text: This hotel is worth the stay. Who would've guessed all three Disney broadway shows were in the same area. Breakfast was decent and it was near a subway station. Bonus. So why a 4? Well elevator was slow and our room was not ready at all and didn't get in till 4pm. Also I dont believe I booked a disabled room. I was given one. I used points so maybe it was whatever was opened. Room was small. All that didn't matter. Will stay again.

title: Great hotel, amazing staff
text: This is a small but mighty hotel. New in November, 2018, it is clean, offers breakfast and warm afternoon cookies and is conveniently located just steps from the 42nd Port Authority Bus Terminal. We stayed for a week and everything was perfect. Love, love, love the staff who made our stay even better. They were so friendly and helpful. Aminata and Crystal kept the breakfast area spotless, inviting and well stocked. Front desk staff Brandon, Chris and Michael, and security guard Jimi went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and well taken care of.

title: Walk on by
text: This is a very weird, un-hotel like hotel.  That picture of the lobby is nothing like it looked when I walked in.  It must be a stock picture as are the photos with 2 queen beds. They have no rooms with 2 beds at this property.  We were send down a weird skinny hall on the first floor to our room that had a patio.  It felt more like an alley than a patio.  Don’t patio’s have furniture?  None at this one.  The lock was not operating properly on the door to the weird patio and I was very uncomfortable staying there overnight.  In fact, before we ever used the room, I went back to the front desk and asked if they would let me leave without penalty because I did not feel safe there.  I am a 40 year customer and I assumed they would let me go with no penalty but they did not so we stayed one night and cancelled our next 2 nights.  We are now in a lovely, much less expensive room at a property about 50 feet down the street.  Much better.  Marriott may have lost a long time customer in me.  Disappointed is not a strong enough word to describe how I feel about this property,  and now, about Marriott’s in general.  Thumbs down!

title: Good hotel stay!
text:
We stayed here 5 nights and enjoyed this hotel.
We were upgraded to a room with a small patio but it was quite useless to us as there were no furniture there ( yet). So eventually we got an accessible room was spacious and comfortable . The room has a small and well equipped kitchenette and a very small round table BUT there are no chairs in the room so this is again all useless because where can you eat? On the bed...?
The room was kept very clean all the time.
The breakfast buffet gets very hectic in the morning. The main problem is lack of tables ( one might consider adding foldable tables during breakfast hours). The buffet itself has a nice variety to chose from and was well maintained all the time by the very friendly Aminata.
Location: the hotel is centrally located -within minutes walk from Times Square (and so it is quite a busy area all the time), numerous restaurants all around.
The staff was very friendly and attentive. We were offered car service to the airport that was much cheaper than all other options and was on time with a great car.

title: Where are the chairs?
text: First, I have to say that I loved this little hotel.  The staff was wonderful and so helpful with suggestions on where to go and directions on how to get there.  They also called a cab when I was ready to leave which I really appreciated.  (Last year, at the Hampton Inn, they sent me out to the street with my luggage and told me to flag one down on the corner!)  Also loved the chocolate chip cookies offered every afternoon - yum!  Be sure to look for the secret doors that will take you directly out to the street.  Much quicker than waiting on the slow elevator.  The two things I didn't like was the squealing in the pipes or fan (not sure which) that would come and go.  Also, where are the chairs?
