There was a nice patio outside the room but no chairs to sit out there.  And there was no chair in the room which made the small table pretty useless and I had to stand or sit in the bed to eat.  Hope this will be remedied because I REALLY liked this place.

title: Very Clean - Great Location - Cozy Suites
text:
This is a great little hotel.  We were in NYC for 6 days and this was the perfect location.  It's 2 blocks from Times Square, a couple blocks from most of the main Broadway plays, and better yet, has a large subway station on the same street for easy access across NYC.

The suites are small, but most are in NYC unless you want to pay way too much money (frankly for space you don't really need).  It was perfect for our trip, as it was just my wife and I.  The hotel is among the cleanest I've ever been in, and I travel a lot for work.  The staff are excellent.

The location, cleanliness and friendliness of staff really made this a near perfect hotel stay for 6 days.  The only heads-up I would give is that the mattresses are firm, and had I

title: Excellente situation
text:
Nous avons passé un excellent moment dans cet hôtel. La chambre était magnifique avec un immense lit, petite cuisine bien équipée, salle de bain fonctionnelle et spacieuse. Le petit + de la chambre : la petite terrasse privative car nous étions au -1.
Le petit déjeuner est vraiment varié et délicieux, nous avons pu manger à l'Américaine tous les matins.

Petit bémol : le personnel n'est pas multilingue, donc, des difficultés à se faire comprendre.

title: No Rooftop Patio Yet
text:
The main reason for bringing family to this hotel for their first trip to NYC over the AC (which we love), was the idea of their BYOB rooftop patio.  Unfortunately, we found out that it has not yet been completed despite it being advertised on their website.  This may sound minor, but we could've stayed at the AC for about the same price (on this trip, including parking), which we feel is nicer hotel overall with a great rooftop lounge and restaurant.

Not the fault of this Towneplace, but valet parking at the AC was less expensive than the "self park" garage closest to this Towneplace location.  ~$80 w/ tips vs $134 for ~28hr (SUV) at both.  I'd suggest finding another garage, because we witnessed one driver spin the tires of a Camaro 4 different times as we waited for them to bring ours.  Just imagine what is done when people aren't standing around watching them move vehicles.. 

Complimentary breakfast was very basic, but similar to other Towneplace locations that I've stayed.  More pull up tables needed, and people were waiting for staff to restock certain items.  It was incredibly crowded the on the Sunday morning we ate there.  It still adds some value to the hotel.

Rooms are on the small side, but clean.  Material choices are generally nice, but we did have a couple problems with our room (shower doors couldn't contain all of the water, and sliding barn door fell part way off).

Good location, with many food choices within two blocks.  Value added.

Staff was exceptional.  Value added.

title: excellent service
text: arrived late at night for a reservation that we booked through Airbnb only to find out that this property did not do business with Airbnb and that our host scammed us. The night manager Daniel was exceptional in his efforts to first contact Airbnb on our behalf, then finding us room in another hotel since they were fully booked. As we waited, several other guests arrived, and other hotel occupants who had requests, and all were taken care of in a friendly and efficient manner. Even though we did not stay in this hotel, we have all praise for the staff that was there that evening who went out of their way to make our visit to NYC a pleasant one. And the hotel Daniel found for us (also a Marriott property) was very comfortable and similar in price and still within close proximity to all the attractions we wanted. Thanks Daniel (and Barron too)!

title: Very Comfortable Stay
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of February. The hotel is new so the rooms are very clean, comfortable and modern, so very happy with that. Room size was pretty good, obviously not a huge suite but very spacious by NYC standards. Thee kitchen area was useful and with a refrigerator we could store food and drink too. Free wifi, and TV connects up to Netflix if you want to. Bathroom modern and nicely designed.
Our room was in the basement, and was probably an accessible room. It was next to a very well equipped fitness room that I used regularly whilst there.
As others have mentioned, there are a few issues with the breakfast area in that it is way too small, and it seemed quite often that the food and coffee had temporarily run out. It won't spoil your stay but they really should deal with it. The food quality and variety is good that said.
Location wise, it is really close to Times Square and Port Authority Bus Terminal. The Subway entrance is at the end of the block so perfect location if you want to get away from midtown. Loads of eateries nearby.
We found all the staff really helpful and very sociable. They are an asset to the hotel.
Normally i would stay at Hilton properties but thought i'd try Towneplace as there was a deal on. Overall i was impressed and i will definitely look to stay here again when in NYC.

title: Perfect for NYC Home Base
text: Just returned from a theater weekend in NYC.  This hotel is the perfect location for the theater district and mid-town.  We walked as far south as 30th and as far north as 65th.  Only took the subway once - half block away.  The room is small, but very well laid out.  Had a king room on the 6th floor in the backside of the south tower.  Very quiet.  The oversized chair hid a single bed.  The kitchenette was well equipped including a dishwasher!  The bathroom was good sized for one person at a time.  There is one open closet.  No drawers so your suitcase becomes your dresser.  The gym is huge with plenty of equipment.  The included breakfast has something for everyone. The staff was great especially Chris with local recommendations.  Will definitely return!

title: Clean but very small rooms
text:
Great location for visitors to the Times Square area.  The rooms and lobby were clean.  I would not stay here with another person.  Acceptable for one person, not more.  
>Small rooms.  
>No chair, table or desk in the guest rooms.  There's 1 small piece of furniture for the ice bucket.  
>Rooms have a small refrigerator, microwave oven, dishes, kitchen sink.  If you'd like to eat you could use the ice bucket piece of furniture as a (very small) table and sit on the bed.  
>The only drawers are in the night stands next to the bed.  The clothing rod for hanging clothing is about 16 to 18 inches long (approx.).  There's a poorly located shelf under the clothing rod which prevents almost everything from hanging freely.  Basically inadequate clothing storage.  
>I had to get the clock/telephone replaced due to a non-functional display.  
>And, even though I told them several times, the lighted sign on the outside of the hotel with the hotel's name was not on during our entire stay.  
>The breakfast buffet Tuesday morning wasn't properly stocked (i.e., no butter).  
>On arrival I could not connect to the hotel's wireless network.  I ended up speaking with a tech support person for the organization that supplies the service to the hotel.  After over an hour I was finally successful.  I'm an I.T. consultant and was extremely frustrated by the experience.

Kudos to Daniel (?) for his patience and assistance with the network issue.  By the way, I was one of at least 4 people who had this connectivity issue.

title: Vacaciones
text: Muy buena la ubicacion del hotel, muy comoda. Todo limpio, las habitaciones son comodas tambien, lo unico que critico es que tienen un placard muy chico, no entra casi nada. Nosotros nos quedamos siete noches y nos hubiera venido muy bien un placard. Sin perjuicio de ello, limpieza, atencion de los empleados, ubicacion, desayuno fue muy bueno.

title: Great location!!
text: In the ♡ of midtown, just a couple blocks from Times Square. The staff was great and the room was clean and comfortable. NY prices vary wildly at times, but this was a good value in March. Subway stop a block away.

title: The place to stay in NYC
text: This is a lovely hotel just off Times Square and around the corner from Hell’s Kitchen. The staff were lovely and very helpful and the room was tidy and quiet. There is a kitchenette, stocked with everything you could want. We also went round the corner to shake shack and took it back to our room. The beds were comfy and the room was clean and tidy. Would definitely stay again.

title: Exceeded Expectations!
text: Our family of 5 were very comfortable in our room, plenty of space, which you don’t expect in NYC!  The staff, in particular, Barron and Daniel, went above and beyond to make sure we had a suitable room for our needs and everything was perfect for our stay.  The hotel was very clean and offered complimentary continental breakfast.  Would highly recommend!

title: Hidden Gem
text: We stayed here in Feb and although the Hotel is relatively small ( no bar ), it suited our needs. The rooms are very clean, the staff are friendly and the local is great! We stayed in one of the back room and couldn’t hear any of the road noise. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location and staff!
text: This hotel was perfect! Great location and a very nice staff. A new hotel with free breakfast and no resort fees. Close to subway entrance. A block away from Time Square. The room has a king sized bed and a small couch as well as a small kitchenette.

title: Not for the claustrophobic
text: This was the tiniest room I have stayed in in New York (or anywhere else). It is so small, you can't open the kitchen drawer because of the entry doorknob. I felt quite claustrophobic. If you don't need a kitchen, skip this location as the sound from the refrigerator will keep you up all night (plus it takes up unnecessary space). There was not table to eat in the room and no desk for me to get work done. In addition to the small space, the ceilings are quite low, which makes you feel like you're in a doll house. There was no bottled water offered at check-in or recognition for elite status. The only saving grace is its location.

title: Excellent location and nice clean and spacious rooms.
text: Stayed for three nights. Excellent location and nice clean and spacious rooms. Front office staff were very helpful. Great happy hour in Bar. Exercise room onsite. Breakfast available in the restaurant

title: Super hotel
text: Tento hotel odporúčam pre super polohu, výborný personál, vždy nápomocný. Raňajky boli skvelé, dobrá káva, omelety, miešané vajcia, sladké pečivo, wafle.... a hlavne boli až do 10:30. Izby veľmi čisté, každý deň upratovanie. Bola som veľmi milo prekvapená týmto hotelom. Na TIMES Square je to cca 300 metrov, metro stanica kúsok od hotela. Lokalita naozaj TOP!

title: Great Hotel
text:
My wife and I just got back from a 4 night stay here. Overally it was a good stay. 
Positives.  Check in went smooth and the agent was very friendly and helpful.  The room itself was nice. There is a small kitchen area if you do want to cook or even reheat something.  Bed was comfortable, the bathroom was nice with good water pressure.  The breakfast in the morning was basic, but was good. At night, they do have some coffee, water, and hot chocolate (which being it was cold during our stay, this was really good.)  The location is great.  You are a few blocks from Times Square and all the action.  We went to see Harry Potter, and the theater was only about 2 blocks away.  Loved that Shake Shack was at the corner, and even though they were busy, we were so close that we went back to our room to eat it. Overall the staff was very friendly and helpful.

My only negatives/concerns.
Our room had a small table, but there was no sort of chair.  We were not sure if this was because we were given a handicap access room or not.  So we just ended up eating our dinner on the bed.  Also, the area that can be used for hanging up your clothes was a little confusing.  There was a bar to hang things up, (obviously being a handicap access room, the bar was lower, so we understood that...however, we found that the bar was useless because the shelf below was so close to the bar that unless you were a child or a little person, the items didn't hang properly. Only other thing was that I had booked my rate way in advance.  Well our plans changed and we ended up being able to stay an additional night.  When I called the hotel I asked if they could honor the rate that I booked originally.  They said no, and that I would just be able to book the additional night at the new rate (rate was almost $100 more.)  So I waited until just before we left and saw that the rate had gone down a little bit, so I did book. I then called the hotel again and got an agent that combined my reservation so that I would not have to change rooms (that was nice).  

Overall I would definitely stay here again and recommend to other friends.

title: Perfect location
text:
Very good location.
Within walking distance from Broadway and Times Square.
Good price/quality.
Friendly and helpfull staff.
Clean.
Has a small cooking area in the room.
It is highly reccomandable to people Wanting to visit by foot midtown NY

title: Highly recommended hotel!
text:
Just returned from a week long trip for my son's 21st birthday. We had 2 queen rooms on the 5th floor. The hotel was perfect for our needs. Check in was easy and the staff were really helpful. Chris checked us in and was really friendly and couldn't do enough for us throughout our whole stay. The room was perfect and a nice size, this was our third trip to NYC and this was by far the best room for size and facilities. The kitchen area was really useful for making a cup of tea and snacks. The bed was comfy and the room was quiet. The TV was great being able to use your own Netflix was a good touch after a long day sightseeing and shopping. The bathroom was a nice size with a decent shower. Couldn't fault the room at all, it's all brand new and well thought out. I've stayed in the Roosevelt and the Pod previously and this far surpassed both of them on every level. Having breakfast included as well was great because I've found previously that this isn't usually the case with New York. We're not early risers, so usually went down for breakfast between 9 and 10 and found there was plenty of choice- waffles, porridge, bacon, eggs, muffins, yoghurt and it set us up for the day nicely. Being able to come back of a night and grab a coffee on your way back to the room was nice as well. 
Overall our stay was perfect, couldn't fault the hotel in any way. Some people have complained about the lift being slow, but it seriously wasn't a big deal I think people just like to complain about something- first world problems! It was my son's 21st while we were away and Chris and another member of staff (I've forgotten his name sorry) put a balloon, cake, card and voucher in his room while we were out to surprise him and I thought this was such a nice touch and highly unexpected- my son was really made up with this, so thank you so much! 
100% we will stay here again on our next trip to New York, the location was perfect for the days you were too tired to venture far- Times Sq is on your doorstep and we actually used the subway a lot on this trip because there's a station at the end of the block, so was really easy to get about.
Thank you so much for an amazing trip, perfect hotel and lovely staff!

title: Amazing Location, Friendly, Clean, Would Absolutely Return.
text:
A short trip visiting the city. Check in was quick and easy. Room was perfect, the ability to brew fresh coffee everyday was a godsend when we didn't quite get the body clock on track for the duration of our stay. Super clean as so new. All amenities provided in the room. 
Breakfast was great - always lots of choice and being re-stocked. I made a breakfast bagel or muffin each day but there were yogurts, cereals, make your own waffles, toast, and 2 hot choices each day along with a variety of juices and coffee/tea. 
Coffee in the lobby was available all day and there was a pitcher of orange infused water which was perfect when returning from a days walking round the city. 
Just over the road was a bar, restaurants, a bring your own Thai (lovely food) and there were takeout places within 2 minutes walk.
Located just off Times Square we had no issues with noise at all and although the elevator was occasionally a little slow we (having read the other reviews) just had a little chuckle to ourselves that this was a reason to grumble about for some?!!
Would absolutely recommend and return to this hotel if we ever re-visit. 

One thing I would say (and this could be a Stateside thing) was that the towels in the bathroom did not need to be replaced everyday, it did seem a bit wasteful energy wise to do so? Maybe a sign on the wall saying if you want fresh towels to leave on the floor but if not then happy to re-use? As I say, might just be 'the done thing' over there and certainly didn't have any effect on our stay!

title: Does the job
text:
Great convenient location. Nice clean room, comfortable bed but could do with more storage for family room. Breakfast plentiful and good. Was nice to have coffee available all day especially after long days in the cold weather. Staff friendly and helpful and always available in reception. 
Would use again if I’m lucky enough to return to New York City.

title: I'll Take Manhattan (Suites)
text: Close to all the best attractions NYC has to offer, these small suites are very well equipped (so you don't have to spend a fortune in restaurants every day), spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The staff are FABULOUS - so charming and helpful - and it really feels like a home from home. The only thing I would change are the furnishings. I'd get rid of the big armchair and small round table (that has no seating anyway) and put in a larger desk/table with seating to eat and a place to work - it would be much better use of space! I'd also add wine glasses to the eating/drinking crockery and utensils. But I loved it and will 100% return. Great value for money. A real jewel in Marriott's crown.

title: Great location and cheerful staff.
text: Location brilliant,staff more than obliging,housekeeping top notch,elevator a pain,table in the room too big and would swop for a bit more storage space,coffee on tap in the lobby a great bonus after a day out in the great city.Would we stay here again?...YES.

title: Perfection
text:
We had a great stay in our queen room with sofa, the room was quite compact but the kitchen area was a great addition as was the comfy sofa. The whole hotel was exceptionally clean and our room was cleaned and tidied daily without seeing a maid once, very unintrusive service.
Reception staff are friendly and efficient. Breakfast was good and set us up for the day. If the price was right we would definately stay here again.

title: Excellent Management
text: Hotel management is excellent and professional Though the rooms are kind of small, it's the city and you'll find that anywhere else. The rooms are clean and updated, and the hotel itself is nice and new.  There is coffee/tea in the lobby, and free breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel as a choice to stay in.

title: TINY ROOM (EVEN BY NY STANDARDS) BUT  GOOD LOCATION IN TIMES SQUARE
text:
First time staying at this relatively new (3 month old?) hotel.
I gave 3 stars - really is "A-OK" 

PROS
1 - Affordable 
2- Location (Times Square)
3 -Brand new (rooms were is great condition)
4 -Friendly staff

CONS
1-ROOM SIZE - you get what you pay for. There is an oversized round table with ice bucket in corner of queen room. Bottom line - table is too big for the room. In the middle of the night, it's pretty difficult to walk around the bed without hitting the table. (Remove the table and put in smaller table or shelf, or add a nightlight)

I have been to NYC 50 -60 times. 2nd smallest hotel room over 50 times.

2-SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOW ELEVATOR. You are waiting about 4 minutes every time for the one elevator bank. 

3-NO DESK/COUNTER- Less people use desks, but 2 people in a queen studio and there is no place in room to sit & use a computer, except bed

4-STAIRCASE is great - curious that it opens into the street. So if you don't want to wait for the slooooow elevator, and hop downstairs to the lobby, you better put on your winter coat, hat & gloves - because the staircase exits to 44th Street.

title: A greAt find!
text:
Nice exterior. Inviting lobby. A comfortable presence of friendly staff. A priceless location and public transportation options steps away and obviously food at every step and turn. (Smith’s Bar across the street is lively good food, with digital Pandora playing. Go ahead and sing aloud, you won’t be the only one, lol). TownePlace has a hot comp breakfast and fast internet. Hotel pics are comparable to actual rooms, a big yay!

I didn’t get everybody’s names but shout out to Ariel, Brandon, Steve, and housekeeping!

title: Fantastic Stay
text:
This is a great hotel, in a great location with great staff! 

My wife and I came to NYC for the weekend and am so glad we chose to stay at this Towne Place Suites!

The rooms are new with all the amenities that you would need, including a refrigerator, a microwave, even a stove top and dish washer. 

It also is in a great location, on 8th just off the chaos of Times Square and right in the heart of the Theatre District and Restaurant Row. 

But just as importantly, the staff was fantastic. So friendly and accommodating! It was my wife’s birthday and they helped make it a very special weekend for us. 

I would definitely encourage you to stay at this hotel!

title: A perfect place for your NYC tour
text:
Stayed at the TownePlace suites for 3 nights.
The place is perfectly located near the times square. The place is quite new.
The rooms are comfortable and relatively large, including a kitchenette.
The staff is super friendly, and the breakfast is nice.
I would definitely go back on my next visit to NYC.

title: Would definitely stay here again
text: New property so everything is nice and clean. Rooms are fairly good size for NYC and have full kitchenettes. Great location a little removed from the craziness of Times Square, but still very convenient for getting around. What really stands out about the property is the friendliness of the staff. Only downside is that there is no in-room safe, but you can lock items up at the front desk where they have a "safe-deposit box" system.

title: Good overall
text:
I stayed at that hotel for one night only but I checked in super early.
It's a brand new modern hotel in NYC. Noticed a very artsy crowd more than business.
Pros:
- Location: right in the heart of the action. Theaters, movies, stores, restaurants galore. Any type of transportation right there. Easy to walk to anywhere. Uber safe.
-Premises: spotless. Very clean. I'm a germaphobe so those things are very important. Nice kitchenette with everything to cook and eat. Small fridge. Nice TV with lots of options (Hulu, Netflux, Youtube included).
My room was at the highest floor (7th) and in the back. So zero city/street noise. Was very pleased. The buildings in the back are not so close and not higher. So that's great for privacy and you have some view of some NY nice buildings! Nice big windows: very luminous room!
-Friendly and helpful staff (front desk and security) . Come to you and really try to solve your issues. Let me check in at noon.

Cons:
-Room is small but expected from a brand new hotel in NYC.
-Breakfast: basic at best, not a lot of options at all for a Marriott. But nice/clean/modern breakfast area. Served till 11.00 am though!
-Waiting/sitting area is not separated from breakfast area.. So during breakfast hours, those eating and not eating are all in the same area.
Incident:  Because of the Polar Vortex, my plane arrived at 3.00 am in JFK from Paris. I got to the hotel around 8.00 am. I was very exhausted from a long trip and the jetlag. I was told I had to wait until at least 11.00 am to get a cleaned room. Which I understood completely. I tried to hang out and walk around, but it was freezing outside and I could barely stand on my feet (exhaustion). I went to the sitting/eating area and I just fell asleep naturally (my body was really out of it). I was sitting and I unconsciously fell asleep. An attendant (the somewhat tall, AA, heavy set lady taking care of breakfast) woke me up loudly, abruptly and rudely saying "Ma'am, you can't sleep here!". I have never heard that in my life and I travel a lot. If you cater to travelers, this will certainly happen. Exhausted travelers fall asleep even if they are not deliberately trying to, which was my case. So from 9.00 am to noon, I felt literally tortured, because I had to force myself to stay awake. Sorry this is inhumane. The bigger hotels do not have that appalling policy. That attendant treated me like I was some non desired homeless person. It was such a bad experience. Felt very uncomfortable and humiliated. That has to be corrected. This hotel is not cheap, so please do better.

Overall: good hotel (as long as you are not exhausted). They deliver what they are supposed to offer.

title: Perfect for Theater Visit
text:
We spent 3 nights in very cold Temperatures. Two blocks to each of the theaters was wonderful plus plenty of restaurants close. Hotel is new and the staff is very helpful. Marie took great care of us and Daniel was great on checkin.
Rooms are small but good layout, and very clean.
We stayed in the South Tower . Only 4 rooms per floor and very quite. Rooms 615 or other floors 15 room has a more open layout with Queen bed and sofa. I found the sofa very comfortable for laptop work or watching TV. The King bed room looses the Sofa.
Nice breakfast with eggs, meat, waffles and other items.
Great hotel at this price point. I will be back.

title: Excellent stay!
text:
We stayed one night here during our last visit to NYC amd I can say I highly recommend! 

The location is perfect, close to the heart of Time Square and the theatre district, great shopping on 5th ave and great restaurants.

The rooms, while small, were very nice, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good, lots of options, but it can get quite crowded at the busy times. 

My only criticism was the staff. Some were less helpful and to call them friendly would be a stretch. 

Overall I would stay here again, and recommend to anyone who wants a nice, clean place close to attractions.

title: Aún no estaba listo
text:
El hotel tiene una ubicación inmejorable. Nos alojamos a fines de noviembre cuando tenía pocos días de abierto. Nuestra habitación estaba en "la torre" y había que caminar por un largo pasillo para llegar a ella. A la habitación le faltaba iluminación y se sentía olor a cañería.
El desayuno no es muy variado y el lugar para tomarlo es pequeño, pero tener el desayuno incluido es un gran ahorro. La habitación es muy linda y muy completa, y el personal es muy amable. Tiene algunos aspectos por mejorar pero creo que se convertirá en un gran hotel, tal vez me aloje aquí cuando vuelva en abril.

title: Great location!
text: This is a brand new hotel in a great location!  The room is not huge, but we're use to that.  We stayed here before getting on a cruise and it wasn't far for us to walk to cruise terminal from hotel (20-25mins).  The hotel is approx 5 mins walk from bus terminal and approx 20 mins from Penn Station. We took the train from airport.  It was very busy since it was over the holidays so it was difficult to walk anywhere...you definately need to pack your patience. There are alot of restaurants close by, close to Hell's Kitchen area and having a mini-kitchen in room was great since we could warm up food, make food if you wanted to since they had everything in kitchen, coffee/tea (provided), including a dishwasher.  The hall ways are small and elevators aren't the fastest, but we didn't have any issues with it.  Breakfast was good enough to start the day, although they did run out of some stuff. Staff at the front desk are friendly and very helpful!  Not alot of room to walk around in the room, not alot of storage and if you do eat there is no table in room. The tv channels are great, including HBO on demand. We would stay here again!

title: They aim to please
text: Conveniently located for both business and leisure activies this recently opened hotel has much to offer. Kitchenette is a definite plus. Quieter than anticipated given the location.  An eager staff aimed to please made this guest feel mist welcome

title: Friendliest Staff!
text:
Recently stayed one night in this hotel. Had the pleasure of dealing with staff members from three different shifts (arrived early to a room that was ready, was up late). Everyone was very friendly, offered parking assistance, made restaurant recommendations, opened doors for me, said goood morning, good evening and good night! Always asked how we were doing and if we needed anything. And again that was on three shifts with three different sets of staff members! 
Room was a good size for the city, clean, and the kitchenette is fabulous! Bathroom was a good size, could actually move around. Our room was right next door to elevator and didn’t hear it once, and noise from street was almost non existent, the soundproofing was wonderful for a room in the city! Location is perfect to see a show. With plenty of excellent restaurants and bars in walking distance. 
Breakfast is included and although I didn’t have anything as I had that fabulous kitchenette, everything was well stocked, looked fresh and kept clean. 
But overall it was the staff that won me over! (and the clean room) I’m bad with names, but honestly it’s not necessary because every person who was on duty from January 6th through January 7th was a pleasure to speak with. 
Definitely will be returning the next time we are in to see a show.

title: Excellent
text: Fantastic services from all staff including Marie, Chris, Brandon and Daniel, all staff make you feel very welcome. Absolutely brilliant service would highly recommend! Rooms were modern, clean and tidy.

title: Perfect location
text: Brand new hotel. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Our king room had a perfectly appointed kitchen. Not a bad size for NYC. Just blocks from Times Square. Only down side is there is only one elevator. Never really had to wait to long for it. So if you are inpatient try to get a low level room and take the stairs.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Great hotel in the heart of it all. Within short walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Center, broadway theaters, many restaurants & shopping. Metro station is less than a block away to navigate all over the city. The room was clean & comfortable, complimentary hot breakfast was great and the staff was very friendly and helpful (thanks Douglas & Michael). We will def be back for future visits to the city.

title: Brand new hotel with prime location
text: We stayed here for 3 nights during our recent trip to NYC. Rooms were very clean and in great shape and a decent size for NYC standards. They have mini-kitchens in each room which is convenient for those who may want to have snacks/small meals in their room. The staff are genuinely friendly and very helpful. We would stay here again. Can't beat the location - right in the heart of the theatre district  with short walk to subway, numerous restaurants and entertainment.

title: Nice hotel
text: We stayed here for 4 nights over Christmas holidays. The hotel was really close to everything around Times Square and if you take a left out the door to 9th you will find nice restaurants out of the crazy crowds. The check in was perfect. They even let us check  in before 3 as we arrived early. The hotel room was the queen size and came with a small kitchen. It was clean and a pretty goid size for NY. The staff were very friendly throughout  the stay.  More good was the free hot breakfast. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Met our needs well
text:
We were three people in a queen/sleeper suite for three nights.  We had to pack heavier than normal due to a mixed bag of weather during our trip, and we had just enough storage space for the contents of two roller bags.  Our backpacks were not unpacked. It is a tight squeeze with the twin sleeper pulled out.  We only used the coffee maker and refrigerator in the teeny yet well-equipped kitchen. No desk space if that is a requirement for your stay.

Everyone we interacted with was very friendly and helpful, so service is five stars. The breakfast was good, but if you need to eat a lot of fiber you should bring your own prunes. There's not a ton of space in the breakfast room so there are opportunities to form new friendships at shared tables.  There is some modular furniture in the lounge area, but more table options during breakfast hours would be useful.

The hotel is constructed in two towers, and we were in the back tower so used the funny little hallway other reviews have referenced.  We didn't find it to be a problem, but it could be for those who have mobility issues or an abundance of luggage.

Noise insulation from outside the hotel is very good, but we found there was a lot of noise from inside the hotel. Between earplugs and active days, the noise didn't keep us up.

Location is excellent, with lots of great restaurants nearby.

title: Nice and new
text:
We just returned from a 2-night stay.
THE GOOD:  Location is a 2-min walk from the subway and many restaurants.  Its all brand new.  The staff are all very nice, requests for extra bedding and bathroom supplies were fulfilled in 5-min.  The room (queen + a sofa bed) is typical NYC small, you will be disappointed if you think you are getting a suite.  The sofa bed was fine for a couple of nights but re-think that if you are staying longer.  Nice bathroom with no hot water problems, towels are plentiful, thick and fluffy, average toiletries.  The windows open, the tv is easy to operate.  There is a pretty well-kitted out kitchen and we appreciated the small fridge.  Nice and quiet room overlooking other rooms and the Intercontinental next door.  The heat worked fine.  There was only one elevator to the second building where we stayed but it was efficient with no long wait times.  The rate I secured was very reasonable.
THE BAD: there are apparently two separate buildings here, but they are joined by a very, very, long walkway to the elevators.  This is inconvenient, although of course they are restricted to the existing lot.  The lobby/breakfast area is far too small.  The breakfast is not that great, although the lady working the area was very pleasant and even came around to take away dirty plates; there was no oatmeal on one of our days, and even though it was only 9:00, it was never replenished.  Plastic cutlery and paper plates should be a big no-no now, I don't know why Marriott is going this route.  Regarding the room, there was no desk area or drawers, just a small little portable table, which was not very useful.  The bathroom has no hooks, not one. There were too many stray hairs (that were definitely not ours) that made their way into the bathroom from the carpeting in the room.
Overall, it was nice to stay in a new property, and would recommend it.

title: decent budget option
text: Good option near many restaurants/theaters.  Clean.  Room design made good use of space and provided a complete galley kitchen.  Only one elevator in main part of hotel so it can take a while to get to/from room.  Breakfast options are decent, but while the front desk was well staffed, the food staff seemed to have trouble keeping up with replenishing items.

title: These are not Suites - misleading name
text: The front desk staff was nice, the hotel itself is brand new so the rooms are all in perfect shape but they are very very small - not suites, more like walk-in closets with a small kitchen.  The elevator is very slow and there is only one so staff is using it most of the day.  Taking the stairs is best option so if you have to book here ask for a room on lower floor.  Location is good if you are going to city for theatre, but there are better and cheaper options around

title: Very promising, but not yet up to speed.
text:
We knew that a brand new property would not yet be running well, but I expect to see improvement coming quickly.  We found check in running very quickly and our room ready early using the Marriott Mobile Check in through their app. We were in the section called the "Tower" separated by a long skinny hallway from the main building. The hallway was way too narrow requiring you to occasionally wait if a cart or service wagon was moving through from the other direction. Unfortunately, this looks like a fault that can not be corrected. Once in the Tower, there seemed to be only 4 rooms per floor so it was very quiet and the elevator waits were very short.  The room itself was very nice in color, lighting and decor. Lots of outlets for chargers and something I have not yet seen in any other hotel, a multi-connector charger located next to the clock just in case you have left yours behind.  We only spent one night, so I have no impression of housekeeping other than the room being clean on arrival.  The quirk is in the bathroom. Spacious and well lit by New York standards, there was no provision for hanging a used towel. No bars, no hooks, nothing.  We provided the desk our comment about this during our quick and effortless check out and they noted it into their system but also indicated that it had been reported many times before and they are working on a solution.  Breakfast also looks promising but is not running well yet.  There were 2 staffers in the room but when we arrived with no apparent crush of business ahead of us, they were nearly out of eggs and breads.  Water pitchers were empty, no napkins were available and I was unable to locate any butter. 

I loved the location, only a block from many theatres, yet fairly quiet, and just a few blocks from dozens of Times Square and Hell's Kitchen restaurants.  I would expect that everything except that connecting hallway will be improved with a little experience under their belt and I will absolutely look here again when heading back to the city.
